story:
Why are we doing this?

We found it a challenge to buy delicious & healthy snacks for children (for the age of 4 -12).  Most snacks have added sugar and are full of unnatural stuff. We decided there must be a way to make healthy snacks attractive for kids.

We both lived in Afrika and witnessed that malnutrition in underdeveloped countries has a very bad influence on the development of young children. We have also seen that creating a fundament in the form of healthy food is relatively ‘easy’. By giving children a healthy, nutritious breakfast every day, they gain more energy, they can concentrate better and they are not distracted by an empty belly.

The idea of Lolo’s was born. We could develop a healthy nutritious snack for kids and at the same time feed hungry children in the world.

We believe kids deserve good food and we take this very seriously. For all our products we promise it:

  • is 100% natural 
  • has no added sugar
  • is 100% Organic.

How we do it?

To make sure that as many children as possible are nutritiously fed by a trustworthy foundation, we work together with the Futurelife foundation. Futurelife is the producer of Unity, a porridge developed by food experts who focus on the importance of absorption of vitamins and minerals by the body. One portion of Unity contains 70 % (!) of the advised daily nutritional intake for a child.

What are we funding?

After almost 7 months of learning and testing, we now have great prototypes. We are really excited to bring our snacks to the shelves. We are ready for the next step: starting our production, so we can really make an impact in the lives of the children.

We made a financial breakdown so you can see what we will do with the funds we gather:

When you add all these factors together - it comes out to 40.000 euro’s.  Pff, yes, we know it is a lot but if we have this amount we are able to make a direct impact in the lives of the children. We're confident that with this amount we will be able to produce the first batch of two varieties Lolo’s and make Lolo’s available in stores, schools and sports clubs.

Project Time Line

May 2017: Idea was born

July: Testing products + partnership Top chef Margot Janse

Aug: Design, branding + testing more products

Okt: Partnership Futurelife Foundation

Nov: Beta product

Dec: Kickstart campaign

Jan/ Feb: Start production

March: Launch of Lolo's & Start selling

We teamed up with great experienced partners to create this product and to make sure that the right children receive the nutritious meal from Lolo’s.

We can’t promise it’ll be a journey without bumps in the road, but we’ll always keep you updated and informed and we’ll do anything to get you enjoying your Lolo pack and at the same time make an impact in the life of a child! 

Take a bite, feed a child!
story_txt:
Why are we doing this? We found it a challenge to buy delicious & healthy snacks for children (for the age of 4 -12).  Most snacks have added sugar and are full of unnatural stuff. We decided there must be a way to make healthy snacks attractive for kids.We both lived in Afrika and witnessed that malnutrition in underdeveloped countries has a very bad influence on the development of young children. We have also seen that creating a fundament in the form of healthy food is relatively ‘easy’. By giving children a healthy, nutritious breakfast every day, they gain more energy, they can concentrate better and they are not distracted by an empty belly.The idea of Lolo’s was born. We could develop a healthy nutritious snack for kids and at the same time feed hungry children in the world.We believe kids deserve good food and we take this very seriously. For all our products we promise it:
is 100% natural 
has no added sugar
is 100% Organic.
How we do it? To make sure that as many children as possible are nutritiously fed by a trustworthy foundation, we work together with the Futurelife foundation. Futurelife is the producer of Unity, a porridge developed by food experts who focus on the importance of absorption of vitamins and minerals by the body. One portion of Unity contains 70 % (!) of the advised daily nutritional intake for a child.What are we funding?After almost 7 months of learning and testing, we now have great prototypes. We are really excited to bring our snacks to the shelves. We are ready for the next step: starting our production, so we can really make an impact in the lives of the children.We made a financial breakdown so you can see what we will do with the funds we gather:When you add all these factors together - it comes out to 40.000 euro’s.  Pff, yes, we know it is a lot but if we have this amount we are able to make a direct impact in the lives of the children. We're confident that with this amount we will be able to produce the first batch of two varieties Lolo’s and make Lolo’s available in stores, schools and sports clubs.Project Time LineMay 2017: Idea was bornJuly: Testing products + partnership Top chef Margot JanseAug: Design, branding + testing more productsOkt: Partnership Futurelife FoundationNov: Beta productDec: Kickstart campaignJan/ Feb: Start productionMarch: Launch of Lolo's & Start sellingWe teamed up with great experienced partners to create this product and to make sure that the right children receive the nutritious meal from Lolo’s.We can’t promise it’ll be a journey without bumps in the road, but we’ll always keep you updated and informed and we’ll do anything to get you enjoying your Lolo pack and at the same time make an impact in the life of a child! Take a bite, feed a child!

story:
About The Sauce & Me

As a home cook who has always loved hot sauce, I was starting to get annoyed with the constant bombarding of gross-tasting heat in all these gimmicky sauces! All heat, no flavor and NEVER would you consider putting them on food.

I wanted something with flavor, depth, controlled and natural heat and a combination of flavors that hit different spots on the tongue. SO, my hot sauce was born!! 

Tropical Coffee Habanero is a blend of Mango, Espresso grounds and Habanero peppers! With all-natural ingredients, the sauce is 100% vegan and gluten-free.  

The sauce has been APPROVED by the Cornell Food Lab as shelf-stable and safe!

My goal is to make food that has ingredients you can pronounce, flavors you recognize and love, and no hesitancy due to lack of knowledge of these crazy ingredients other sauces use. 

Funding & Rewards

The funding that I am seeking is ONLY for the cost of health department inspections, courses, certifications, and licenses. ALL the things that NY makes you go through when you make a hot sauce. This money would allow me to be able to start selling online, at farmer's markets and to stores & restaurants. 

ANY DONATION AMOUNT IS WELCOME!

What you will get: 

  • $10+ higher pledge - 5oz bottle of Hot Sauce
  • $25+ pledge - 3 of the 5 oz bottles of Hot Sauce
  • $50+ Pledge - Personalized Bottle of Sauce with One-of-a-kind Label
  • $100+ or more - 5 of the 5oz bottle of Hot Sauce AND a LIFETIME 30% discount on future bottles

I am only asking for the funds for licenses. I am not looking for everyone to fund this company, I want people to be able to still get my sauce in some way while I go through the rigorous and extensive process that NY state requires when you make something this acidic! 

This is a chance for you to support an independent business that could grow exponentially, and a chance for me to continue sharing my passion for good, clean and natural foods with the world!

story:
The upside pan is a startup created in 2016 that aims to revolutionize the way of cooking.

Eating is an everyday act, and our goal is to find the system that will simplify the preparation of your meal so that its practical and above all, a pleasant moment.

This is why we have set up a machine that combines the positive points of an oven, and the speed of a cooking on the stove.

With THE UPSIDE PAN, you can cook easily, quickly and safely.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The only product in the world that cooks food without having to turn it !

The heat comes from above and comes on the baking plate, which heats the food from below.

 

 

Automatic oil filter integrated in the hob, and directly sent to  recovery box.

 

 

To whom it never happened to find his steak burned in his pan...This now part of the past! We work to integrate a timer on the product to be able to cook in any serenity.

 Receive 2 trays of cooking for more possibility.

 

 

 

To cook frozen foods or simply to warm an already cooked dish, cook what you want.

 

Materials : Non-Stick Meterial / food grade coating / aluminum

Power : 1300w

Function : Automatic Oil filter, Lamp 45° horizontally rotating (auto power off) Fan in the lamp cover for cooling

Certification : CE,CB,LFGB,ROHS

Voltage : 220-240v/110v

Accessory : Round Plate: 37cm / square plate

Button : 5 levels temperature adjustment

Cable leanth : 1.4m

Protection Functions : Short circuit, over charge/discharge, over-load

 

                           

     

The prototype phase of the product is already finished, we raise funds to launch the mass production phase, but also integrate the timer, which requires the manufacture of a mold and the change of some internal electronic components. We thank you in advance for your support and we trust you to disseminate our project on social networks in order to discover the world THE UPSIDE PAN, the new way of cooking !!!. We chose indiegogo for its dynamism and its influence in the field of innovation, but also for the commercial springboard that this can bring us in order to spread our product in the most countries.

Q. How to change the cooking trays ?

A. Nothing's easier! Just lift it with a hand and replace it.

Q. Can we cook everything with this product ?

A. Absolutely, you can cook frozen or fresh foods and even reheat previously cooked foods.

Q. When will the delivery be made ?

A. Delivery of backers is planned for middle July 2017.

Q. What happens if the funds requested have not been collected ?

A. If the funds necessary for production have not been received, we will proceed to the full reimbursement of backers.

Q. The product is guaranteed?

A. Yes, the product is guaranteed 6 months.

More question ... You can contact us on info@theupsidepan.com , we will answer you with joy and in the shortest possible time!

story:
Story

Vegan Armenian Kitchen is a collaborative project between Lena, a vegan cook and writer based in Toronto, and Siroon, a photographer and creative director based in Los Angeles. They met in Armenia in 2012, and reunited in Los Angeles six years later to set the wheels in motion for this endeavor. After living in Armenia for six years, Lena is on a mission to not only veganize the Armenian dishes she grew up with, but also highlight the plant-based staples present in both Armenia and the diaspora. Siroon, with her unique vision and style, is passionately bringing the recipes, stories, and the cookbook itself to life.

Integral components of Armenian dining include abundance, generosity and a love of food. Vegan Armenian Kitchen will showcase that it is possible to cut down or eliminate animal product consumption while still being able to enjoy Armenian classics.

While the recipes are the main component of this venture, Vegan Armenian Kitchen is an all-in-one resource for Armenian cooking which is intertwined with its rich culture and heritage. From food idioms and detailed explanations on dishes, names and customs, to pantry staples, menu pairing and holiday planning, Vegan Armenian Kitchen will be an invaluable tool that will serve not only to educate and fascinate readers on Armenian cuisine and history, but also inspire them to create the plant-based and veganized dishes in their own kitchen!

What We Need & What You Get

We are pouring our hearts and souls into research, content creation, recipe writing and testing, collecting stories, photographing, and creating videos -- the majority of which is done apart from each other, with occasional travel to our respective cities as well as to Armenia. Our goal is to raise $18,000 in order to cover the costs of publishing, designing and printing 1500 high-quality hardcover cookbooks, which include approximately 250 pages filled with stories, photos and recipes.

We will be donating a portion of proceeds from each cookbook to Centaur, the only animal-assisted hippotherapy center in Armenia, that also operates as a rescue horse and dog shelter. More information on Centaur can be found below.

We also have a wide variety of exciting perks for our special backers! They include:

  • A signed copy of the cookbook as soon as it’s available
  • An Armenia-themed tote bag
  • The ability to participate in a vote on which dishes from the cookbook become video recipes
  • Your name/business thanked in cookbook (if desired)
  • An invite to our book signing party for Vegan Armenian Kitchen
  • Promotional perks (for sponsors)

The Impact

While the cookbook is intentionally made up of both authentically plant-based dishes and veganized classics, our cookbook is for everyone--vegan or not, Armenian or not. Whether you are vegetarian, pescetarian, reducetarian, lactose-intolerant, observing Lent, or just looking to add some life into your plant-based dishes, Vegan Armenian Kitchen is the cookbook for you.

The preorder and sale of each cookbook also guarantees a donation to Centaur Animal-Assisted Therapy & Rescue Center.

Photo: fëdor kornienko

Centaur Animal-Assisted Therapy & Rescue Center was established in 2008 by Hasmik Hovhannisyan in Ushi, Armenia. Since its opening, the center has provided treatment for over 1000 people and rescued over 400 animals.

It is a one-of-a-kind place where stray animals and those that are in danger are rescued and trained for animal-assisted therapy (AAT). The team at Centaur teaches them that humans are their friends, and for some it takes years — due to extremely bad experiences in the past. And vice-versa: the dogs of Centaur professionally treat cynophobia (fear of dogs) in both children and adults.

“Therapeutic dogs help children with autism thrive by entering a relationship where they become naturally responsible for the well-being of their furry friend. People with cerebral palsy benefit from our horses: within a few first hippotherapy sessions, the physical and mental condition of most people improve.”

Today the goal is to educate new therapists — both furry & two-legged alike — and make AAT more accessible in Armenia by partnering with more rehabilitation & crisis centers and orphanages. To do this, Centaur has partnered up with Orphans & Their Dogs, PeaceCorps and PAWS Armenia and has launched collaborative projects. All donations to Centaur convert into food, training and daily care for therapy animals.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot financially contribute to our fundraiser, that's okay! If you would like to support our work, it would mean the world to us if you could:

  • Share our fundraiser with friends and family
  • Post our fundraiser on social media to help spread the word
  • Follow us on Instagram and sign up to our newsletter!

Other Ways You Can Help

Share our fundraiser with friends and family
Post our fundraiser on social media to help spread the word
Follow us on Instagram and sign up to our newsletter!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Max Debbas, and I am starting a program called Cocoa Crate. Cocoa Crate is a Monthly Chocolate Box Subscription program, that helps the farmers in Ecuador, and brings the worlds greatest chocolate to peoples doors! 

The idea for Cocoa Crate grew out of passion. I have been in the chocolate industry my entire life.  My father began making chocolate over 40 years ago, and I followed in his footsteps as soon as I could walk.  Chocolate is more than a food for me, chocolate is more than a passion, chocolate is my life. 
I want to share the experience of quality chocolate with the world. And by doing so, help the people that make chocolate possible.

What Cocoa Crate is All About.

There are 2 foundations of Cocoa Crate:

1.  "Helping people do chocolate right." 

Chocolate is the worlds most consumed candy, yet the majority of people who eat chocolate have never truly eaten premium chocolate.  Our chocolate is a true bean-to-bar product!  Our chocolate is hand-made, with premium ingredients, and no compromises.  My families chocolate company has won numerous awards, including the "Best Product Line" as well as "Grand Champion" 3 years in a row at the Americas Best Professional Food Competition.  Cocoa Crate is our way of sharing this incredible chocolate with you!


2. "Helping people do right by chocolate."

Cocao growers and their families get paid less than 2 dollars per day.  This does not allow children in these communities to afford an education, or families to develop a greater style of life.  Cocoa Crate is looking to change this by buying our beans at a higher cost directly from Co-Ops that we have helped set up.  We are also working closely with the Equitable Trade Fund to give a percentage of each sale back to the farmers.  Through the Equitable Trade fund, we are helping to build schools, and train farmers in the agricultural skills they need to increase cocao yields.  By purchasing a Cocoa Crate subscription, you are directly helping the farmers who have helped bring this incredible chocolate to your doors!

                     

What We Still Need and Why

  • Cocoa Crate already has much of our structure setup.  Our chocolate factory has been running for over 30 years, and is already producing chocolate that is sold across the globe.
  • My family and I have also been to Ecuador and met with the farmers who are growing  our cocao beans.  By working with The Equitable Trade Fund, we have helped setup the co-ops and infrastructure needed to help the Ecuadorian Communities.
  • I am seeking the current capital to launch the Cocoa Crate program without adding additional overhead costs. 
  • By raising this $500,000 we will be able to finish purchasing our packaging, complete the shipping infrastructure, as well as finish creating the E-Commerce back-end on our website.

The Impact

Through Cocoa Crate we are helping build schools, train farmers in better agricultural techniques, and increase the price per pound that cocoa beans are purchased for.

  • This is helping put an end to the vicious cycle of child labor in the cocoa farming communities.  
  • We have had great experience with helping the Ecuadorian communities.  By helping setup the Equitable Trade Fund, we have healthy relationships with the farmers, co-ops, and cocoa processors.  Cocoa Crate will continue to grow these relationships and expand to aid more communities.
    

    How else can you help?

    • Spread the word!  Please share this campaign and idea with your friends, across social media and with the world!
    • You can also use the Indiegogo Share Tools to share this project.

You can also use the Indiegogo Share Tools to share this project.

story:
I started making pasta for girls' night.

I grew up helping my nonna Josephine (grandmother, in Italian) make pasta for special meals like Easter and Christmas.  Now I make it for the girls when I have them over for dinner.  Friends love my innovative pasta and joked about me starting my own business (being unemployed at the time).

Then I started researching and found out that there is a need for a pasta to shake up the category.  Bloom Pasta was born.  I've verified product fit by interviewing 100+ potential consumers and food professionals about my product.  I wrote a business plan and a pitch deck. I spoke with packaging companies and frozen food manufacturers. 

Now it's time to move to the next stage and start producing large amounts of samples - that is, to move up from hand-rolling and hand-cranking, to upgraded kitchen products that use electricity and motors to accomplish the same tasks in less time!

What Your Contribution Means

Your contribution will help me begin prototyping - making samples to finalize my recipe development, for focus groups, and for marketing events.  Your contributions will be used to build my "starter kit" of mixers, scales, mixing bowls, and other items needed to start this business.

The Impact

Bloom Pasta is a startup, but has a vision of how it will give back to the community once it's underway.  Bloom Pasta will be a manufacturing facility located in an underserved community in Broward County, Florida.  My dream is to  employ locals from that community by providing them an option within walking distance.  

This is Only the Starting Point

This equipment is part of my earliest activities as a startup business.  My plan is to move into a commercial kitchen space once I have some momentum.   This equipment will help me get those initial orders!  

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • You can help get the word out by sharing this page with others using the Indiegogo share tools,
  • And you can go to www.BloomPasta.com and sign up.  I'll be sending updates on the progress of my business' development every 2 weeks,
  • Go to Facebook and Like my page
  • Follow BloomPasta on Instagram

Thanks for any help you can provide!

story:
We Believe In The Power Of Food

Vegan Chef Ray is excited and ready to launch The Plantbased Shack Project. The Plantbased Shack Project is not just a Cafe it's a gathering place for the community. He has created a delicious"vegan" plantbased menu based on feedback from the community.  The PB Shack will give Patrons what they have been asking for more days  Wednesday - Monday  and more hours.   Plus have the needed space to host community events such as Let's Talk Vegan, Happy ThanksVegan, Cooking Courses, Meetups and accept more requests to work with local schools and Nonprofits.

Our Goal

There are  some amazing spaces available in St. Pete,. The Plan is to open The PB Shack in early September 2019 on or near Central Ave. A space has come available that is quite exciting and could turn out to be the perfect location.  We will need to act quickly which is why we are asking for your help to raise $10,000. with Indiegogo's flexible funding campaign.  We ask that  you continue contributing if we meet our goal. The more we raise, the sooner we will be able to reopen and we can honor more request to support community events.

Your Perks

We have seven (7) great packages for you to choose from.  Each package increases in value by increasing the number of perks you receive. There is something for everyone.

Our First Perk is Yes to The PB Shack  it gives everyone the opportunity to be a part of this exciting  project. It's for backers who give $5 You will receive •A heartfelt thanks,•Notice of Grand Opening, •Listed on The PB Shack website as a Contributor,•Added to newsletter list which will give updates, and information on plantbased living.

Our  Second Perk is I Heart The PB Shack  is for backers who give $10 or more. You will receive •A heartfelt thanks,•Invitation to quiet opening, preview menu,•Listed on The PB Shack website as a contributor,•The PB Shack's Closed Facebook Group for Backers.•Receive advanced notice of events, specials, discounts on products•Enter in drawing for two tickets to Happy ThanksVegan Dinner,

Our  Third Perk is Eat More Plants  is for backers who give $15 or more. You will receive •A heartfelt thanks,•Invitation to quiet opening, preview menu,•Listed on The PB Shack website as a contributor,•The PB Shack's Closed Facebook Group for Backers.•Receive advanced notice of events, specials, discounts on products•Enter in drawing for two tickets to Happy ThanksVegan Dinner,•Ebook Transitioning to Plantbased Eating

Our  Fourth Perk is Virtual Cooking Class with Q & A  it is for backers who give $39 or more. Chef Ray will do a live cooking Class making several dishes from the Ebook  You will receive •A heartfelt thanks,•Invitation to quiet opening, preview menu,•Listed on The PB Shack website as a contributor,•The PB Shack's Closed Facebook Group for Backers.•Receive advanced notice of events, specials, discounts on products•Enter in drawing for two tickets to Happy ThanksVegan Dinner,•Ebook Transitioning to Plantbased Eating,•Virtual Cooking Class with Q & A,

Our  Fifth Perk is Tasting  it is for backers who give $39 or more. It's for those who live local,plan to be local or what to give as a gift to someone local.  You will receive •A heartfelt thanks,•Invitation to quiet opening, preview menu,•Listed on The PB Shack website as a contributor,•The PB Shack's Closed Facebook Group for Backers.•Receive advanced notice of events, specials, discounts on products•Enter in drawing for two tickets to Happy ThanksVegan Dinner,•Ebook Transitioning to Plantbased Eating,•Virtual Cooking Class with Q & A,•Tasting of The Plantbased  Shack Menu

Our  Sixth Perk is Name that Dish  it is for backers who give $199 or more. It's for those who live local,plan to be local or what to give as a gift to someone local.  You will receive •A heartfelt thanks,•Invitation to quiet opening, preview menu,•Listed on The PB Shack website as a contributor,•The PB Shack's Closed Facebook Group for Backers.•Receive advanced notice of events, specials, discounts on products•Enter in drawing for two tickets to Happy ThanksVegan Dinner,•Ebook Transitioning to Plantbased Eating,•Virtual Cooking Class with Q & A,•Tasting of The PB Shack Menu •Which will include The Dish You Name (must be appropriate for all ages and respectful, dish will be vegan. Management reserves the right to request several names and choose the one that best fits with menu)

Our  Seventh Perk is House Party for 25  it is for backers who give $899 or more. It's for those who live local,plan to be local or what to give as a gift to someone local.  You will receive •A heartfelt thanks,•Invitation to quiet opening, preview menu,•Listed on The PB Shack website as a contributor,•The PB Shack's Closed Facebook Group for Backers.•Receive advanced notice of events, specials, discounts on products•Enter in drawing for two tickets to Happy ThanksVegan Dinner,•Ebook Transitioning to Plantbased Eating,•Virtual Cooking Class with Q & A,•Tasting of The PB Shack Menu •Vegan Dinner for 25 ,  2 appetizers, Choice of 2  Main Courses, 3 sides and dessert (Delivery Must be Local within a 50 miles of St. Petersburg FL)

Keep in mind  if you don't live in the Tampa Bay area  you may still participate by taking virtual cooking classes and our Free Let's Talk Vegan Events which we will video and will be made available as podcasts. We want anyone anywhere to be able to learn from us, which is why we  will be offering memberships to a site filled with information on plantbased living.

Another Way You Can Help

We want to be a part of  the restaurant healthy food revolution.  Please support our mission to help make St. Pete one of the best places to eat sustainable healthy plantbased food.   We want St. Pete not only to be one of the safest places in the world  but one of the one of the Healthiest Cities to live in. Know that  Serving Delicious Whole Plantbased Food Makes Us Happy.

Thank You for taking the time to read about our campaign. We have received so many calls asking when we were going to reopen. We are excited  and hope that you are too. Please help us by spreading the word and asking those who believe in the power of food to consider contributing. Thank you , and we can't wait to see you at The Plantbased Shack!

story:
My Love of All Things Chile Pepper (and my cat, Izzy)

My mom's family is from the town of Clarksburg in the Sacramento-San Joaquin Delta and they've been farming in the area for 6 generations - almost 160 years. Mom was adamant that we learn how to grow our own food, that we knew where our food came from, and that we ate well. I have been gardening since I was old enough to walk and carry small tools. Chile peppers have always been a big part of my gardening. My first love was chile rellenos that my mom made for us at the end of the season. Of course, as I grew up my chile pepper horizons expanded and my addiction to all things hot and spicy led to a love of hot sauces.

I've been making salsas for a few years and now I want to turn those into hot sauces. The contributions from this campaign will help me buy the equipment I need to get started, refine my recipes, search for the best quality, locally-available sources for my ingredients, and help pay for some of my branding.

If the R&D phase goes well, I will have the tools I need to launch my company. This is an exciting time to be starting a food business in Sacramento. I would look for every opportunity to partner with local growers who grow organically and sustainably and with local businesses who support the local Sacramento food scene.
 

What You Are Funding

You may well ask, "Where is my money going?" You would be funding several things. 

  • Equipment - I need buckets for bottling and fermenting, bottles, caps, and labels. I will also need an immersion blender and assorted small kitchen tools. I will also need smoking boxes and wood chips for smoking chile peppers. Yes, some of my recipes will include smoked chiles!
  • Recipe development - I already have two fully conceived recipes that are ready to be transformed into sauces. The first is an habanero, pineapple, mango pico de gallo based on a traditional recipe from the Caribbean! The second is my take on a traditional Mexican style hot sauce with cascabel, roasted poblano, and Fresno chiles with a tomatillo base. All of this recipe R&D means lots of ingredients!
  • Conceptual artwork - Everyone who has purchased artisan hot sauce knows that artwork and label design is important. I'm going to be hiring a friend of mine to design my company logo and help with my label design. The company logo will feature a cartoon of my cat, Izzy! It will be ready to go when the company launches! 

Rewards

PERKS! - Some of what you are funding will go directly into your perks.

  • All contributors will be invited to a tasting at Burly Beverages Gift Shoppe & Tasting Room in Sacramento, CA. I will be working a chef friend of mine to develop great hot sauce pairings.
  • Contributors of $20 or more will receive the tasting plus at least one 2 oz. bottle of hot sauce.
  • Contributors of $50 or more will receive the tasting plusat least one 5 oz. bottle of hot sauce.
  • For contributors who are unable to attend the tasting:
    • At the $10-20 level, I will ship two 2 oz. bottles of hot sauce.
    • At the $20-50 level, I will ship two 5 oz. bottles of hot sauce.
    • At the $50+ level, I will ship four 5 oz. bottles of hot sauce.

Why Support Dizzy Izzy's?

You would be helping me fulfill a lifelong dream to make hot sauces that I can market in Northern California, and maybe even beyond! I would also be committed to seeking out local growers and supporting their missions to provide the best quality, fresh ingredients to the Sacramento region and Northern California.

Risks

There is very little risk in contributing. If I don't make at least $100, Indiegogo returns the funds to you. If I receive $100-200, I will realistically be able to provide a tasting at Burly Beverages Gift Shoppe & Tasting Room. At the $200-300 funding level, I should be able to provide the tasting and ship bottles of sauce to those who can't attend. At $300+, I should be able to meet all of my perks with no issues.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

If you don't have any funds to spare, you can still help support this campaign!

  • Share the link on social media or via email.
  • Join me on the Dizzy Izzy's Hot Sauce Co. Facebook page! That page is the best place to get news first!

story:
Since popping-up for the very first time less than a year ago in December 2019, Lion Cub’s Cookies has grown faster than even we could have predicted, and is becoming another one of Columbus’ own, storied, beloved brands.  What started as a guy behind a fold up table, has blossomed to a team of 11, serving tens of thousands of cookies, all in less than a year, a crazy year at that to say the least.

We’re still a very young company, but we’re growing up right in front of your eyes, and we’re now ready to take the next step: we are ready for a new home, a home we invite you to help us build.  Your contributions will allow us to finally be readily available to any and all who want to experience Lion Cub’s Cookies.  To this point we’ve done our best to reach as many people as possible while operating out of a shared commissary kitchen, and we’ve done all we can.  But, to take the next step and to finally be able to spread the cookie love, we need to do this, and we’ve never been more excited to do so.

Our new home will be at 1261 Grandview Ave. in Grandview Heights, right next to a couple other Columbus beloved brands: Jeni’s, Staufs, Grandview Café…the fit seems so perfect, we can’t wait, and we hope you will contribute to this campaign and build our new home with us.

 

We’re hoping to raise $40,000 to help pay for the equipment in our new space!  We should have enough to cover the construction costs but we need your help to make our home complete and functional! The space we’re moving into is going to get an incredible makeover, it’s going to look, feel, and have the aroma of space that you can be proud of.  In return for your generous contributions, we have a range of rewards we hope will make you feel like you’re getting something neat in return, we think we have something for everyone in here.  Our perks range from cookies, to dough making parties, to swag that comes with lifetime discounts associated with it!  

 

 

Once we move into our new home in Grandview Heights, we plan to have a space that everyone is welcome in, no matter who you are, where you’re from, what you believe in.  This will be a space where everyone can enjoy themselves and get the best cookies on the planet. 

This space will finally be a space where people can come say hi to us, and get cookies when it is most convenient for them, their friends, and their families.  We also plan to continue building out our delivery service once in this space, as that has become part of who we are and we know how much many of you appreciate us doing that.  The way in which we approach delivery may change, we hope to become more advanced and more readily available here.  This space will allow to us to shed the limitations we faced in our previous space, and we're so excited about that. 

 

We understand not everyone has the ability to contribute to this campaign by buying perks and that's ok!  What would be awesome for anyone though, whether buying perks or not, would be to simply spread the word!  Tell all your friends, share our story with them, tell them who we are and let them know what we're trying to accomplish with this campaign!  Also, if you or your friends aren't already, we highly recommend you follow on us IG/Facebook @lioncubscookies!  

Less than a year ago in December 2019, I popped up a 6-foot fold up table and crossed my fingers…nervous doesn’t even begin to describe how I felt, I slept two hours the night before.  I didn’t know if anyone would show up honestly, this was a new concept in town and after all, what did I know, I was a civil engineer by day, student by night, and spent what little time I had obsessing over my new found hobby: cookies (not baking, literally only cookies, I don’t know how to bake anything else really).

Fast forward 3 months and we had 6 successful pop-ups under our belt!  We broke the North Market pop-up record on our first day there and each time we went back we kept breaking our own record, it was so exciting, I felt like we had a bright future ahead of us, it was just a matter of time.  I say we because by this time I had 3 part-time employees that helped me make dough one night a week, all of whom are still a part of the team today; pretty cool right?

Then, things changed.  COVID-19 hit, businesses shut down, people got laid off, mandatory quarantine, no more pop-ups.  At first I figured we’d wait it out and pop-up again when possible.  But some of those layoffs affected my employees as well.  Two of my employees lost their other jobs and they asked me if there was anything I could do to keep them busy…this is the turning point in the short but exciting story that is Lion Cub’s Cookies.

Two days later (yes, all of two days of planning went into this), I had an idea to keep them busy: delivery.  I stayed up until 2 or 3 am each night planning how we could pull this off, I was exhausted from my day job, but I was determined.  I viewed this not only as an opportunity to help them out, but also to show them that I actually cared about them, they were more than just employees to me, and I wanted to show them they could always trust me to act in their best interests, something that will benefit us for years to come. 

The early days were rough, we did everything manual, from taking orders, to collecting payments, to planning routes, you name it.  But we grew and adapted, we got better everyday, constantly changing how we did things until we found what worked best, and eventually with the help of technology we were able to grow delivery way faster than I ever thought!  We went from doing deliveries one day a week, to two, then three, then we started hitting the suburbs too.  Before I knew it, we grew from a team of 4 to a team of 11 in a matter of months. 

Our growth over the last couple months has been exhilarating, and I don’t ever take for granted what we’ve been able to do together over the past year.  There weren’t too many bright spots in our country in 2020 but here we are, a start-up with the most humble beginnings, growing amidst a global pandemic, putting smiles on peoples faces, keeping people employed, and staying true to who we are the whole time. 

What we’ve done to this point will always be a part of who we are, but we have so much more left to do.  We have so much more left to achieve, and we are now ready and eager to take the next step with you: we want to open up our very first store front, we’re ready for a new home. 

Our current home, The Food Fort (a shared production kitchen) has been great to us, and has allowed us to grow as much as we could, but we’re ready for more…and  we think we’ve found a perfect home, and we want you to be part of this, we want to build this together.  You’ve been such a huge part of what we’ve done to this point we didn’t see any other way than to do this together.

When I say together, I truly mean that.  It refers to not just me and the rest of the Lion Cub’s team, but the community that has formed around us and rallied to support us: you.  What you have done and meant to me alone, I honestly can’t put into words without getting emotional in some way.  You’ve allowed me to chase a dream of mine now, and you’ve allowed me to do it in all the right ways. 

I could go on and on about this but I want you all to know regardless of the future of this company, this will be a chapter in my life I never forget, the first time in my life I felt like I was living with a purpose.  My purpose now is to continue to build something with you that we can all be proud of.  By donating to this campaign you are taking a stake in what we’re building together, and I wouldn’t want it any other way.

Cheers to the future.

even begin to describe how I felt, I slept two hours the night before.  I didn’t know if anyone would show up honestly, this was a new concept in town and after all, what did I know, I was a civil engineer by day, student by night, and spent what little time I had obsessing over my new found hobby: cookies (not baking, literally only cookies, I don’t know how to bake anything else really).Fast forward 3 months and we had 6 successful pop-ups under our belt!  We broke the North Market pop-up record on our first day there and each time we went back we kept breaking our own record, it was so exciting, I felt like we had a bright future ahead of us, it was just a matter of time.  I say we because by this time I had 3 part-time employees that helped me make dough one night a week, all of whom are still a part of the team today; pretty cool right?Then, things changed.  COVID-19 hit, businesses shut down, people got laid off, mandatory quarantine, no more pop-ups.  At first I figured we’d wait it out and pop-up again when possible.  But some of those layoffs affected my employees as well.  Two of my employees lost their other jobs and they asked me if there was anything I could do to keep them busy…this is the turning point in the short but exciting story that is Lion Cub’s Cookies.Two days later (yes, all of two days of planning went into this), I had an idea to keep them busy: delivery.  I stayed up until 2 or 3 am each night planning how we could pull this off, I was exhausted from my day job, but I was determined.  I viewed this not only as an opportunity to help them out, but also to show them that I actually cared about them, they were more than just employees to me, and I wanted to show them they could always trust me to act in their best interests, something that will benefit us for years to come. The early days were rough, we did everything manual, from taking orders, to collecting payments, to planning routes, you name it.  But we grew and adapted, we got better everyday, constantly changing how we did things until we found what worked best, and eventually with the help of technology we were able to grow delivery way faster than I ever thought!  We went from doing deliveries one day a week, to two, then three, then we started hitting the suburbs too.  Before I knew it, we grew from a team of 4 to a team of 11 in a matter of months. Our growth over the last couple months has been exhilarating, and I don’t ever take for granted what we’ve been able to do together over the past year.  There weren’t too many bright spots in our country in 2020 but here we are, a start-up with the most humble beginnings, growing amidst a global pandemic, putting smiles on peoples faces, keeping people employed, and staying true to who we are the whole time. What we’ve done to this point will always be a part of who we are, but we have so much more left to do.  We have so much more left to achieve, and we are now ready and eager to take the next step with you: we want to open up our very first store front, we’re ready for a new home. Our current home, The Food Fort (a shared production kitchen) has been great to us, and has allowed us to grow as much as we could, but we’re ready for more…and  we think we’ve found a perfect home, and we want you to be part of this, we want to build this together.  You’ve been such a huge part of what we’ve done to this point we didn’t see any other way than to do this together.When I say together, I truly mean that.  It refers to not just me and the rest of the Lion Cub’s team, but the community that has formed around us and rallied to support us: you.  What you have done and meant to me alone, I honestly can’t put into words without getting emotional in some way.  You’ve allowed me to chase a dream of mine now, and you’ve allowed me to do it in all the right ways. I could go on and on about this but I want you all to know regardless of the future of this company, this will be a chapter in my life I never forget, the first time in my life I felt like I was living with a purpose.  My purpose now is to continue to build something with you that we can all be proud of.  By donating to this campaign you are taking a stake in what we’re building together, and I wouldn’t want it any other way.Cheers to the future.

story:
À propos de l'artisan

 

 

Maëlig est une passionnée ! Artisan chocolatier de 30 ans, elle souhaite aujourd'hui mettre à profit sa créativité et son savoir-faire, au service de sa propre clientèle en créant sa chocolaterie.

Forte de ses expériences passées, elle aspire à travers son entreprise, à promouvoir ses valeurs professionnelles humaines, écologiques et respectueuses de la matière.

 

Son histoire

 

Maëlig a d'abord commencé son parcours avec des études d'archéologie pour suivre ses premières passions : l'histoire et l'art.

Mais c'est au cours d'un salon, qu'elle découvre le monde riche et merveilleux du chocolat et tombe amoureuse de cet artisanat.

Sa soif d'apprendre, sa motivation et sa nouvelle passion, convainquent tout au long de son parcours puisqu'elle débutera sa carrière aux côtés de M. Saillant, au sein de la pâtisserie chocolaterie, glacerie et confiserie Maison Cochet, à Saint-Raphaël. Au cours de trois années très formatrices, où elle apprend la fabrication, l'amour de la matière et l'art du métier, elle obtient deux diplômes : un CAP Pâtisserie et la Mention Complémentaire Pâtisserie, Chocolaterie, Confiserie, Glacerie.

 

Par la suite, elle continue de suivre sa passion et intègre la Maison Saunion à Bordeaux. Aux côtés de M. Lalet, et pendant un apprentissage de trois ans, elle obtient son CAP Chocolatier, Confiseur, ainsi que le BTM Chocolatier, Confiseur, plus haut diplôme dans la profession.
Devenue Artisan Chocolatier, elle continue son aventure au sein de la Maison Saunion pendant trois ans, où en plus de vivre de sa passion, elle accompagne à son tour, les apprentis dans leur formation.

 

Sa passion

 

 

 

Quel est le projet ?

 

Maëlig souhaite ouvrir sa chocolaterie à Saint-Émilion, pour y proposer ses créations tout au long de l'année. Ses chocolats seront le reflet du patrimoine local, mais surtout de sa passion. Des chocolats, donc, pour les fêtes, les occasions spéciales ou pour la gourmandise, mais aussi des bonbons tels que des caramels ou guimauves, et des glaces en été pour accompagner une douceur au chocolat. Une offre variée, pour séduire les yeux et les papilles des locaux, comme des nombreux touristes, de passage à Saint-Émilion.

 


Future boutique et laboratoire à Saint-Émilion

 

 

Réalisations chocolatées par Maëlig

 


Guitare, clown, barres bicouches praliné-noisette, ganache café, ganache mangue, spécialités pop-corn, tête de lion, gourmandises de chocolat, poissons et bien d'autres.

 

 

Quelles sont les valeurs de l'entreprise ?

 

QUALITÉ : en respectant la matière et en sélectionnant des matières premières de qualité (fournisseur de caco choisi pour ses valeurs proches de celles de Chocolaterie Maëlig).

HUMANISME : en travaillant aux côtés d'entreprises locales, familiales et à taille humaine (partenariats avec des acteurs locaux, valorisant le patrimoine de la région).

RESPECT DE L'ENVIRONNEMENT : en travaillant avec des emballages éco-responsables (packaging à base de cosse de cacao, biodégradable et éthique).


À gauche : les matières premières séléctionnées ; Au centre : le patrimoine de la région ; À droite : les emballages éco-responsables créés par Thibault Bergeron

 

 

Pourquoi contribuer ?

 

Votre contribution à ce projet n'est pas qu'une donation à une entreprise en devenir. C'est également un moyen de soutenir l'entrepreneuriat féminin, l'artisanat français, les commerces locaux, de valoriser le patrimoine français et de soutenir une entreprise dans sa démarche d'éco-responsabilité.

La naissance de Chocolaterie Maëlig sera porteuse des acteurs régionaux, en proposant des partenariats avec les entreprises locales. Soutenir Maëlig dans son projet, c'est un moyen de soutenir sa région.

Chaque contribution compte !

 

 

Comment seront utilisés vos dons ?

 

Vos dons serviront à financer le matériel nécessaire au lancement de l'activité, soit des équipements comme un four, une broyeuse, un robot coupe, une tour réfrigérée, un batteur, des moules, etc. Le détail complet du budget est à retrouver comme suit :

 

 

Ce que vous recevez

 

 

 

D'autres façons de soutenir le projet

 

En premier lieu, vous pouvez soutenir Maëlig en partageant ce projet avec votre réseau. 
Vous pouvez également, partager sur vos réseaux sociaux, la page du projet, ou encore, inciter votre entourage à contribuer, soit en partageant la page par e-mail, soit en parlant autour de vous du projet.

Votre soutien et vos partages font toute la différence pour nous !

 

 

Restez connectés et suivez Chocolaterie Maëlig sur :

 

Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/chocolateriemaelig/
Instagram : https://www.instagram.com/chocolateriemaelig/?hl=fr

 

Merci à tous pour votre soutien et à bientôt !

story: Lucky Ones Coffee will employ and empower individuals with disabilities.  Statistics show that 70% of individuals with disabilities are unemployed.  We saw an opportunity to change that!  We get to experience the passion and love these individuals exude everyday and we would like to share that with you.  We are looking to raise at least $30,000 dollars.  We are reaching out to family, friends, the community, and just fellow do gooders to raise money for the start up cost to make this vision a reality.  This kick starter campaign is so close to our heart, not only are we looking to raise money for a down payment on a small business loan but we are looking to make connections within our own community.  We want to invite all of you on this journey to change stereotypes one cup of coffee at a time!

story:
Good cold brewed coffee can take up to 12 hours to make. With FrankOne it is possible to prepare exceptional cold brewed coffee in as little as 4 minutes. Our Vacuum Extraction Technology™ accelerates the process by forcing cold water through finely ground coffee. We ourselves were surprised to try such a strong yet smooth cup made in so little time.

 

FrankOne pulls enough pressure that it is possible to make a shot very similar to espresso. It gives a kick, is sweet, and very intense. 
 

FrankOne has a unique characteristic that sets it apart from other manual brewers: our patented Vacuum Extraction Technology™ uses negative pressure to force water through a bed of ground coffee, extracting more of the flavors that coffee has to offer, while reducing bitterness. Our patented method generates pressure that is strong enough to allow brewing with any grind size; from very fine to very coarse. Different grind sizes mean the possibility of preparing a wide range of brew types and cup profiles–from coffee to cold brew, all with the same machine.

Our patented technology also provides superior convenience and ease of use: press a button and your coffee is ready in seconds.

Save money by avoiding paper filters. Our fine metal mesh filter imparts no flavor into the coffee and lasts for hundreds of uses. The filter can easily be removed for cleaning. 

FrankOne™ charges over USB in just 2 hours and makes up to 150 coffees on a single charge.

Cleaning is a breeze! FrankOne™ is completely waterproof.  

The Golden Cup Standard is defined by the Specialty Coffee Association. The standard is backed by extensive research and is widely used in the industry. FrankOne takes just 30 seconds with a medium-fine grind to achieve the Golden Cup Standard. If you want to get scientific, check out the graph below. The sample we made (red circle) fell inside of the Golden Cup square in green. Note that coffee outside of the standard can be delicious as well! It comes down to your personal preference. 

 
 

By backing our campaign early you will receive FrankOne™ months before the general public has access to it. You will also receive a discounted price of 25% off. You have the satisfaction of knowing you helped bring FrankOne™ into the world. Without you, FrankOne would never exist.   

You can be sure that your money is well invested with us. We have partnered with Dragon Innovation and Avnet who are very experienced in mass manufacturing. They have helped dozens of startups navigate through the perilous world of manufacturing a product at scale. We have already selected our partner manufacturer who is ready to start production 3 days after the campaign ends. Take a look at the factory verification tour we did in preparation for the campaign on Instagram.

story:
How did we discover cacao fruit in the first place? Let's talk about it...

The world today produces too much food. In fact, this food waste amounts to more than enough to feed the whole planet twice! Some people are lucky to have enough, whilst some are not because a lot of food is lost.

In 2018, we traveled to Latin America and met with some local cacao producers who had invented a new way of harvesting cacao beans. Through this new method, they were able to separate their cacao beans and the previously “lost” cacao fruit pulp. After tasting it we decided that everybody should discover this new delicious tasting fruit. Not only would this be a great opportunity to help the farmers get more revenue from their existing crops, but it would also help reduce food waste.

Fast forward to 2021: We now have a final recipe for a new product called Kayu Plant Based Energy, and we need your help to create the first 2,000 cans!

Cacao fruit is sweet, sour, and full of theobromine, which is a natural stimulant - a bit like caffeine. We all need a boost during our busy lives (even at home during lockdown). However, we know that you still care about what you drink. 

We decided to combine cacao fruit, yerba mate, sparkling water, lemon juice, and a bit of plant-based Vitamin B to make a drink that boosts your energy levels whilst still being good for you. No added sugar! No nasties! 

This tiny can allows you to drink with purpose: helping the environment, improving your health, whilst allowing you to discover a whole new fruit.

story:
Short Summary

What "The Basement" will be is a safe haven for all things nerdy. This is the place to go knowing that there won't be any sports on TV or a loud band to interrupt, or worry about being made fun of for being openly a nerd. We hope to create a space that is officially and overtly intended to be everyone's nerdy basement away from home! Movie, Game and TV premieres, Comic Book events, Craft Beverages, Retro Arcade and Console games, Tabletop games, Esports Tournaments, like minded customers and staff to meet and make friends with, the list goes on and on about all of the things this bar is going to have, but the biggest, coolest thing we plan on having is you.

All of these things and events are cool but our focus is going to be dedicated on just having an atmosphere that is relaxed and open enough that any nerd can feel comfortable and enjoy themselves even during events about things they're not familiar with. TVs and Music will be kept at a good volume for conversation, we'll make every effort to make everything we do inclusive, and ensure the space is pleasant and comfortable for everyone there.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We don't need a whole lot in comparison to other starting bars. We're literally going into the basement of an established bar (The Distillery on Heatherdowns) in Toledo, but it's running independent of the bar above it, so we need to raise funds to set the place up and stock it. We're donating a lot of our own time and funds to make our Geekeasy a reality, and despite not having a lot of either, we're almost there. However, with your help, not only will we be able to open the doors, we can also make something truly incredible right out of the gate.

And you'll be a part of it.

We already have had a lot of local interest before doing any marketing and we're confident that this venture is going to be successful. However, it still needs help. If you donate, you're instantly a part of the inner circle. One of the coolest nerds in Toledo's only nerdy bar!

The great folks that donate will be treated like royalty, get their name on a sign on the wall, and get to tell people that they're a major part of what makes The Basement so great.

Sure, there are a bunch of really awesome rewards, but everyone who donates anything will be helping to make a welcoming place for any nerd to call their home away from home (because it will look like the basement of their home) and we'll sing your praises forever. 

The Goal

What we're shooting for is $10,000. That's it, just $10k. We'll take what we can get, which is why we're on Indiegogo, but to really get an awesome space done right, that's what will make it all happen. 

The way the budget looks is this...

  • Inventory - $4000
  • POS System - $1500
  • TVs, Entertainment, Arcade, and Retro Games - $1500
  • Decor and Furniture -$1000
  • Ice Maker - $500
  • Freezer - $200
  • Marketing, Opening Expenses, Rewards, Etc. - $1300

Rewards

All of this is fine and dandy, but what are the goods, right? Well, check this out, all of the following are the first class of rewards and they all fold over, meaning that you get everything that is listed underneath what you spent with in the following...

$5 - Your Name on The Wall

Yup, you get to say how much more awesome you are than everyone else. Bragging rights guaranteed. You get what every nerd covets, the right to tell other nerds that you're more worthy. All we want in addition to that $5 is your photo if you're ok with it. We want to make something special.

$10 - Backer Sticker

Spend a little more and you get to brag a little more. You get your name on the wall, but also you get a spiffy sticker to tell tailgaters what's up! Cover up that stick figure family with something you can actually be proud of!

$15 - Pint Glass

Serious backers demand serious glassware. $15 gets you a backers glass, backers sticker, and, of course, the backers wall.

$25- Shirt

If you chip in a little more, you're gonna get everything above, plus a sweet backers shirt with the nifty logo on it. 'Nuff said, right?

$30 - Invitation to our private backers party

Ok, Shirt, Pint Glass, Sticker, Name on a thing, those things are standard, right? Well, check this out. Toss an extra $5 and you get all of that stuff, plus a special invitation to a super secret backers only Geekeasy party. Break in the place before the lessers and make friendly with the staff so that we all know you first hand and get an extra nod when you come back in.

$50 - Special Edition Backers Growler!!!

Ok, this may be one of the most awesome perks ever offered for a bar. You get all of the above, sure, but the growler is the best part. This is no ordinary growler. This little piece of awesome will get you the honor of having the privilege of getting it filled for the same price as our weekly discount day, FOR THE LIFE OF THE GROWLER!!! That's right! You heard me! This sucker gets you an extra deep discount so long as it lives. Never to be made or issued again!

"Ok, Good for the Plebeians, but what about me?"

Glad you asked.

Just for the extra hardcore and hard pressed geeks in the community, we cooked up a few really awesome rewards. Needless to say, of course you get all of the rewards that the commoners above get, but if you throw down on one of these treats, you get the honor of knowing that you're one of the real serious players in our bar. These rewards go to a very limited number of people and if you're one of them, believe me, everyone is going to know.

$250 - Your Name under ALL of the bar stools! (AKA Guaranteed Bar Bet for LIFE!)

How many times have you been in your favorite bar and wished you had an instant bar version of street cred so you could prove that you're a little more special than most? Or a gimme bar bet where you get to say to anyone new sitting at the bar, "Hey, I bet you $ that you're sitting on my name right now!" Only one person will get to claim this one.

$500 - We name the house beer after you + discounts

If you get this prize, we will name our house beer after you, and, for one whole year, you and you alone, will get any craft beer on draft for $2 off! Only one person will get this one.

$500 - We name the house aged whiskey after you + discounts

Ok, here's the deal. We're going to get a small whiskey barrel with a spigot on it to age our own house whiskies in and if you get this perk, we're going to put your name on it and, for one year, you will get to have whatever is in those barrels for the same price as our well drinks! AND YOU GET TO KEEP THE BARREL WHEN IT'S EMPTY! Limited to three backers only,

$800- YOU GET A YEARLY HOLIDAY AT THE BAR IN YOUR HONOR!!!!!

If you got some money to burn and want something extra special, this is it!!! Limited to 365 backers, For $800, we will make up fake holiday in your name that we will celebrate for years! We'll set aside a day to sit down with you, have some drinks and get to know you, and then we'll come up with a day full of lies about how great you are!

There are also a bunch of perks we added as the campaign went on! Check them out!
story_txt:
Short Summary
What "The Basement" will be is a safe haven for all things nerdy. This is the place to go knowing that there won't be any sports on TV or a loud band to interrupt, or worry about being made fun of for being openly a nerd. We hope to create a space that is officially and overtly intended to be everyone's nerdy basement away from home! Movie, Game and TV premieres, Comic Book events, Craft Beverages, Retro Arcade and Console games, Tabletop games, Esports Tournaments, like minded customers and staff to meet and make friends with, the list goes on and on about all of the things this bar is going to have, but the biggest, coolest thing we plan on having is you.
All of these things and events are cool but our focus is going to be dedicated on just having an atmosphere that is relaxed and open enough that any nerd can feel comfortable and enjoy themselves even during events about things they're not familiar with. TVs and Music will be kept at a good volume for conversation, we'll make every effort to make everything we do inclusive, and ensure the space is pleasant and comfortable for everyone there.
 

What We Need & What You Get
We don't need a whole lot in comparison to other starting bars. We're literally going into the basement of an established bar (The Distillery on Heatherdowns) in Toledo, but it's running independent of the bar above it, so we need to raise funds to set the place up and stock it. We're donating a lot of our own time and funds to make our Geekeasy a reality, and despite not having a lot of either, we're almost there. However, with your help, not only will we be able to open the doors, we can also make something truly incredible right out of the gate.
And you'll be a part of it.
We already have had a lot of local interest before doing any marketing and we're confident that this venture is going to be successful. However, it still needs help. If you donate, you're instantly a part of the inner circle. One of the coolest nerds in Toledo's only nerdy bar!
The great folks that donate will be treated like royalty, get their name on a sign on the wall, and get to tell people that they're a major part of what makes The Basement so great.
Sure, there are a bunch of really awesome rewards, but everyone who donates anything will be helping to make a welcoming place for any nerd to call their home away from home (because it will look like the basement of their home) and we'll sing your praises forever. 
The Goal
What we're shooting for is $10,000. That's it, just $10k. We'll take what we can get, which is why we're on Indiegogo, but to really get an awesome space done right, that's what will make it all happen. 
The way the budget looks is this...

Inventory - $4000
POS System - $1500
TVs, Entertainment, Arcade, and Retro Games - $1500
Decor and Furniture -$1000
Ice Maker - $500
Freezer - $200
Marketing, Opening Expenses, Rewards, Etc. - $1300

Rewards
All of this is fine and dandy, but what are the goods, right? Well, check this out, all of the following are the first class of rewards and they all fold over, meaning that you get everything that is listed underneath what you spent with in the following...
$5 - Your Name on The Wall
Yup, you get to say how much more awesome you are than everyone else. Bragging rights guaranteed. You get what every nerd covets, the right to tell other nerds that you're more worthy. All we want in addition to that $5 is your photo if you're ok with it. We want to make something special.
$10 - Backer Sticker
Spend a little more and you get to brag a little more. You get your name on the wall, but also you get a spiffy sticker to tell tailgaters what's up! Cover up that stick figure family with something you can actually be proud of!
$15 - Pint Glass
Serious backers demand serious glassware. $15 gets you a backers glass, backers sticker, and, of course, the backers wall.
$25- Shirt
If you chip in a little more, you're gonna get everything above, plus a sweet backers shirt with the nifty logo on it. 'Nuff said, right?
$30 - Invitation to our private backers party
Ok, Shirt, Pint Glass, Sticker, Name on a thing, those things are standard, right? Well, check this out. Toss an extra $5 and you get all of that stuff, plus a special invitation to a super secret backers only Geekeasy party. Break in the place before the lessers and make friendly with the staff so that we all know you first hand and get an extra nod when you come back in.
$50 - Special Edition Backers Growler!!!
Ok, this may be one of the most awesome perks ever offered for a bar. You get all of the above, sure, but the growler is the best part. This is no ordinary growler. This little piece of awesome will get you the honor of having the privilege of getting it filled for the same price as our weekly discount day, FOR THE LIFE OF THE GROWLER!!! That's right! You heard me! This sucker gets you an extra deep discount so long as it lives. Never to be made or issued again!
"Ok, Good for the Plebeians, but what about me?"
Glad you asked.
Just for the extra hardcore and hard pressed geeks in the community, we cooked up a few really awesome rewards. Needless to say, of course you get all of the rewards that the commoners above get, but if you throw down on one of these treats, you get the honor of knowing that you're one of the real serious players in our bar. These rewards go to a very limited number of people and if you're one of them, believe me, everyone is going to know.
$250 - Your Name under ALL of the bar stools! (AKA Guaranteed Bar Bet for LIFE!)
How many times have you been in your favorite bar and wished you had an instant bar version of street cred so you could prove that you're a little more special than most? Or a gimme bar bet where you get to say to anyone new sitting at the bar, "Hey, I bet you $ that you're sitting on my name right now!" Only one person will get to claim this one.
$500 - We name the house beer after you + discounts
If you get this prize, we will name our house beer after you, and, for one whole year, you and you alone, will get any craft beer on draft for $2 off! Only one person will get this one.
$500 - We name the house aged whiskey after you + discounts
Ok, here's the deal. We're going to get a small whiskey barrel with a spigot on it to age our own house whiskies in and if you get this perk, we're going to put your name on it and, for one year, you will get to have whatever is in those barrels for the same price as our well drinks! AND YOU GET TO KEEP THE BARREL WHEN IT'S EMPTY! Limited to three backers only,
$800- YOU GET A YEARLY HOLIDAY AT THE BAR IN YOUR HONOR!!!!!
If you got some money to burn and want something extra special, this is it!!! Limited to 365 backers, For $800, we will make up fake holiday in your name that we will celebrate for years! We'll set aside a day to sit down with you, have some drinks and get to know you, and then we'll come up with a day full of lies about how great you are!
There are also a bunch of perks we added as the campaign went on! Check them out!

story:
Peter Newell: The NFB

Newells’ as it is now opened in March, 2018 at The Historic Fort Bidwell Hotel in Fort Bidwell, California. The restaurant is owned by R.K. Newell and his wife, Laura Lee Newell. The location is ran onsite day to day by R.K.’s older brother, Peter Newell who lives on location at the hotel.

Peter has a history in the restaurant industry totaling over forty years in various positions, primarily as a line cook. He also has six years of experience in the banking industry, giving him a great number of skills needed to own and manage a restaurant. He also has a very loyal and helpful staff including a head waitress, baker, additional waitstaff and a busboy. 

This campaign will help to keep a local restaurant in Fort Bidwell, a small rural town in Northeastern California open as it is now. This will also help to keep about five local jobs available and provide the local community with an excellent location for good food. We hope to establish this restaurant as a staple of the community in the future provide excellent foods and a great place for friends and family to spend a meal. 

What We Need & What You Get

The funding goal is $3,000 in order to ensure a smooth transition from RK and Lauralee to Peter and his team. This goal will allow Peter to purchase some equipment for the restaurant, specifically, computer and printing equipment as well as a Point of Sale system, operating software and office supplies. Peter has already taken action to purchase an LLC from which the business will be ran. In addition, some small kitchen tools and appliances will be replaced or updated and supplied and inventory will be taken care of. 

We hope to be able to make this transition as smooth as possible, so the goal is to be able maintain a full stock of all of our inventory for the kitchen, so that we can offer all of our menu options everyday. We also want to be able to build a new, slightly smaller menu with a few more light options and winterize it all for the upcoming season. The laptop computer and the printer and office supplies will allow us to put together updated menus to reflect the changes to the restaurant, while keeping all the favorites. 

Our restaurant is the only BBQ place in over 100 miles, and the only restaurant in 20 miles, making it uniquely located to serve the community. As we transition to update our menu, we hope to be able to offer excellent, simple food options including some BBQ and add in a few local special requests like the California club salad and some additional options for vegetables as well as making the place more walk-in friendly for our special treats like pretzels and donuts. We are hoping to make this restaurant a staple of the community by hosting game nights and making game boards available on all slow nights for guest to come in, grab a snack and have some fun with their friends. 

Our goal is a bit ambitious for a small restaurant to be pursuing, but we believe that this goal is what it will take to really get this place switched over without any big hiccups along the way. 

If we cannot reach our goal of $3,000 from this campaign, we will use whatever funds are earned to make some smaller purchases for the restaurant, depending on how much is earned from this fundraiser. Our other thoughts have included using any funds gained from this to purchase a computer and printer to work with for the restaurant itself, or maybe using our funds to pay for a fundraising dinner for the restaurant itself through Peter and his team. 

We are also on the hunt for reasonable, reliable angel investors or shadow backers to help us fund our project with a loan at a reasonable interest rate. Business loans are not out of the question either, but we are hoping to avoid any loans if we can and keep our business local as much as possible. 

The Impact

Fort Bidwell is a small town, and it is not flush with business here. The Historic Fort Bidwell Hotel, where Newells' is located and where we hope to relaunch The NFB is the only hotel in town, and has had a few restaurants try to make their way at this location. We hope to be one that remains, even as the owners change and we make some alterations. We want The NFB to remain a restaurant that people stop in on a trip or business from somewhere far away and they enjoy the food so much that they go home to Palm Springs, CA or Olympia, WA and tell their families. We want to be a place for the community and a draw for visitors beyond here. 

This location has been running as a restaurant under the ownership of RK and Lauralee for the past six months or so with excellent success, drawing in a good number of people and we hope to maintain that momentum, even as we change over to Peter running more than just the kitchen. 

Risks & Challenges

Peter has plenty of restaurant experience, as we have mentioned, and he has some banking experience that will help him move out of just the kitchen and taken on full ownership of this location. Peter has also built and excellent team to help him along the way. He has been getting business help from Krystal Whittaker, a local seasonal worker who has agreed to stay the winter to help him. She will be utilizing her degree in business management and entrepreneurship to help him put together proper business plans and maintain his bookkeeping. She will also be working in the kitchen as baker, utilizing her experience as a local cottage foods baker and learning about line cooking along the way.

Our team also has Roxanne Klugherz as the head waitress and operations manager for our restaurant as well, utilizing her years of waitressing and managing experience in order to ensure that our service runs smooth and excellent. We also have a waitress lined up to take a spot when we relaunch and a busboy, both of whom are experienced and well trained for our restaurant. 

One of our largest hurdles will be reaching our funding goals to get this project into place and relaunch the restaurant under it's new name with it's new owner. The fundraising is just one of our many projects to help fund our restaurant, and we are very ambitious about reaching this goal before the year is through. Our other hurdle will be to take this business and survive through the winter, when our customer turn over may slow significantly and make sales a bit more difficult. 

We have a few plans in place to work through our funding issues right now, including this fundraiser, and a few more that might develop in the future. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Sharing our story with others is an excellent way to help, please give us a hand in promoting our story across the web! We are also on the hunt for board games and decorative items that match the antique style of the hotel. Even if you can't contribute financially, we would love to have your support through networking. Locals can keep in touch with us as well, and keep an eye out for future fundraising events. 

Thank you all so much for your interest and support in developing The NFB as a local restaurant and hangout spot~!
