story:
We have heard some rumors that the Santa Fe Greenhouse property might be sold. We are open to all options - be it this property or a comparable property in Santa Fe for the Project Urban Greenhouse Farm. Please contact us asap if you know of something.

Local Healthy Food!

Did you know that 27% of NM children go hungry? It's the highest in the nation, but nothing to boast about.

This fact has haunted me for as long as I have known about it, Project Urban Greenhouse was born of it. I thought that if only we could teach children, families and community how to grow food all year round, we could put a huge dent into this problem.

And so it began.

My passions are business, making a change in the world, and the long term sustainability of farming in our arid southwest climate. While the farm will be providing healthy, organic, local food, it will also give us the funding for the work of making sure our kids get enough to eat.

There are no commercial farms in Santa Fe. My name is Darshan and I am starting Project Urban Greenhouse Farm on the former Santa Fe Greenhouses property with a team of experts in Aquaponic farming. I have certification in Controlled Environment Agriculture and I am really excited to bring you healthy food: no preservatives, no pesticides - just fresh, yummy food, all year round.

Your contributions will help us build out the 21,000 square foot facility, with a complete aquaponic system - deep water troughs, vertical towers, fish tanks, plumbing, electricity, backup systems, processing space. It will also help us get us started with the tools and materials we need to grow over 25,000 plants a month - that's a lot of seeds. We'll be growing:

  • Lots of lettuce, types like bibb, dragoon, butter, and romaine
  • Greens like chard, watercress, and kale
  • Herbs like basil, rosemary, thyme, mint, parsley and dill
  • Cucumbers, those cute Persian style ones that are crunchy and delicious
  • Tomatoes
  • Gourmet mushrooms
    • and more...

We estimate it will take 4-6 weeks to get everything set up and running and then it's 4-6 weeks until we are harvesting our first crops.

Once the farm is up and running successfully, we will start putting funding into our 501(c)(3) organization and this is where the work will begin, going out into the community to teach children and families how to grow food all year round. Our idea was to create a consistent resource for our funding, rather than seeking short term grants.

What We Need & What You Get

We are raising $250,000 to set up the farm. Even though we're doing a lot of work ourselves and being very conservative with fixed assets here's an overview of what we think we need to get going efficiently:

  • a cooled walk-in storage space,
  • a delivery truck (cooled),
  • a small pick-up,
  • wood, screws, corner braces, food grade lining and other materials to build the troughs,
  • some hired help to build them (approx 38 troughs, 4'x60')
  • oxygen concentrators, airstones and aeration tubing throughout
  • fish tanks, clarifiers, mineralization tank(s)
  • electrical and plumbing contractors
  • backup generators so nothing dies if there's a brown-out or a black-out
  • a bato bucket system (buckets, lids, plumbing, reservoirs, media)
  • simple monitoring systems
  • and a lot of start up materials - everything from seeds, to gloves, to boxes, grow plugs, office supplies, cleaning supplies, hoses, and so many little things
  • utilities
  • we will hire two people full time once the farm is up and running - it's a lot of space, it takes time and energy to manage 21,000 square feet. This is the minimum amount of help we can get by on and we will hire more people as it moves forward.

What's in it for you?

We've thought long and hard about how we can share with you. What gifts could be better than our own produce? And being very practical, we came up with different levels of giving and packages all including our produce - you get fresh greens and herbs for three months to a year; AND we got creative so that people who are not in Santa Fe can also participate.

For Santa Feans the produce packages will be available for weekly pick up on site (Rufina St, Santa Fe).

For our out-of-state friends or those who prefer to donate the food, we are working with three local nonprofits and you can choose who we will deliver food to each week: The Food Depot, Esperanza Shelter for Battered Families, or the Espanola Ashram Langar program.  Each of these nonprofits has agreed to issue a donation letter which you will receive from them at the end of your donated food cycle.

         

The Impact

Project Urban Greenhouse Farm will produce amazing, local, healthy food for you AND, once it's established, it will contribute to our 501 C3 non profit, Project Urban Greenhouse Impact. Project Urban Greenhouse Impact will teach people, especially those struggling financially, how to grow healthy food all year round.

Risks & Challenges

There are always inherent risks in a start up - the electricity could go out and the fish could die, pests could overtake a crop and require that we pull everything out and start over. To mitigate this risk, all those experts I mentioned earlier, have helped set up systems for proactive Integrated Pest Management (no pesticides! only organic pest control practices!), back up systems that don't fail, and systems and controls to keep on top of things.

Further, the budget has been built in such a way that there is room for some mishaps without the business being put into jeopardy. We think that a great deal of care and attention has been given to Project Urban Greenhouse Farm planning, so that we can be on our toes and proactive in any situation we could imagine.

Last but not least, we have one of the most world-renown aquaponics experts on our advisory team who is very actively helping with design and set up. We feel very equipped to look at any situation and work together to find immediate, viable solutions.

Other Ways You Can Help

The biggest way you can help is to help get the word out. Indiegogo has fantastic share tools you can use, which make it very easy for you to share.

Here's what will help the most:

  • Email your friends with a link to our campaign
  • Share our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest, LinkedIn, Snapchat, and anywhere else you can think of
  • Share at work and other events
  • Talk to your local grocers
  • Ask for a flyer to put up at your office, church or other places

Thank you, thank you, thank you for helping us make our passion for healthy, organic food in Santa Fe a reality.

Project Urban Greenhouse Impact will teach people, especially those struggling financially, how to grow healthy food all year round.

Risks & Challenges
There are always inherent risks in a start up - the electricity could go out and the fish could die, pests could overtake a crop and require that we pull everything out and start over. To mitigate this risk, all those experts I mentioned earlier, have helped set up systems for proactive Integrated Pest Management (no pesticides! only organic pest control practices!), back up systems that don't fail, and systems and controls to keep on top of things.
Further, the budget has been built in such a way that there is room for some mishaps without the business being put into jeopardy. We think that a great deal of care and attention has been given to Project Urban Greenhouse Farm planning, so that we can be on our toes and proactive in any situation we could imagine.
Last but not least, we have one of the most world-renown aquaponics experts on our advisory team who is very actively helping with design and set up. We feel very equipped to look at any situation and work together to find immediate, viable solutions.

Other Ways You Can Help
The biggest way you can help is to help get the word out. Indiegogo has fantastic share tools you can use, which make it very easy for you to share.
Here's what will help the most:

Email your friends with a link to our campaign
Share our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest, LinkedIn, Snapchat, and anywhere else you can think of
Share at work and other events
Talk to your local grocers
Ask for a flyer to put up at your office, church or other places

Thank you, thank you, thank you for helping us make our passion for healthy, organic food in Santa Fe a reality.

story:
Do you enjoy a glass of smooth red or white wine after a long day? You’re not alone. A glass of wine with dinner or before bed has been proven to provide the body with many health benefits. 

However, you can't just have a glass or two without worrying about wasting the rest of the bottle. 

That is why we created Wine Squirrel- a decanter that preserves a glass, or an entire bottle of wine, for weeks at a time- without losing its flavor!

Available for immediate shipping!

 

 

In the Media

 

 

 Feedback from our early backers 

"Wine Squirrel works like a charm! Saved an open bottle for 2 weeks without any degradation in taste. Love it!"  Doug G, Colorado

"Our Wine Squirrel is truly phenomenal! We've kept wine in it for two weeks, and it was as if we had just opened the bottle.This is a MUST for every household that has wine." Austin B, Australia

"I really enjoy my Wine Squirrel. I've been looking for a product like this for a long time."  Craig B, California

"My Wine Squirrel is working very well indeed and will be very useful in the run up to Xmas!" Wendy W, UK

"Wine Squirrel works wonderfully! I even gifted one to one of my buddies who hosts tastings for some of the top wineries in Napa, and he loves it! Great product and glad to have gone with the TriPack!" Jason S, California

 

 

 

The key to the effectiveness of Wine Squirrel is the unique sealing mechanism. This mechanism provides an airtight seal whether you are preserving one glass or most of the bottle. 

The seal is so effective that you can even store the decanter horizontally or flip it upside down without spilling a drop! 

 

 

 

 

We have created an affordable and effective way to avoid oxygen spoiling your wine. With Wine Squirrel, you can have a glass or two of wine and preserve the rest of the bottle for weeks. 

 

 

We have put Wine Squirrel through rigorous testing using different types of red and white wine. What we found was that this is the only solution that is both effective and affordable. 

 

 

Wine Squirrel keeps your wine tasting great, even weeks later. 

Wine Squirrel is the perfect accessory for the nights you want to have just one glass of wine with dinner or to taste-test multiple wines. With Wine Squirrel, you no longer have to feel like you need to finish the entire bottle to prevent wasting perfectly good wine.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The patent-pending Wine Squirrel decanter provides an effective oxygen barrier and preserves your wine. Only Wine Squirrel has all these great features.

 

 

  • Wine Squirrel is easy to use. 
  • Wine Squirrel will quickly pay for itself. Think about how much wine you can avoid wasting. 
  • The Wine Squirrel decanter is elegantly designed and made to look beautiful while it works. 
  • Wine Squirrel would make a perfect gift for any wine lover. 
  • Wine Squirrel requires no consumables to be replaced.
  • Wine Squirrel can be conveniently stored in your wine fridge or a standard fridge door, vertically or horizontally. 

 

USA based backers will receive the original crystal decanter while international backers will receive the new borosilicate decanter.

 

 

 

 

  • When your partner or guest likes white wine but you prefer red. 
  • When you want to compare two different wines to see which pairs best with your meal 
  • When you have finished a bottle of wine and would like just one more glass. 
  • When you only want to have a glass or two of wine but don’t want to waste the rest of the bottle by putting it into the fridge. 
  • If you want to take your favorite bottle of opened wine with you to a party, friend’s house or picnic. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 Meet the Team

 

 

Wine Squirrel is a product of Forever Products LLC, which is a family company founded by Tony Gonsalves and his brother Maurice. Tony, a physicist based in Berkeley California, created the Wine Squirrel concept and developed it in conjunction with Clive Solari from the Sydney-based industrial design firm D3 Design. Maurice is an attorney and wine lover who gave up his job to focus on making Wine Squirrel a reality.

story:
The Franklin Hotel Bar is pleased to introduce it's inaugural offering in the Barrel Buyers Club.

 

A limited number of 60 guests will have the opportunity to pre-purchase a voucher for a bottle of  Knob Creek 9 Year Old, 120-Proof Single Barrel Bourbon to be stored at the Franklin Hotel Bar and consumed neat, on ice, as an Old Fashioned or as a Manhattan at no additional charge whenever they stop in.

 

How the program works:

•Purchase your membership to the Franklin Hotel Bar Barrel Buyers Club:  Knob Creek 9 Year Old, 120-Proof Single Barrel Bourbon for $149.

•For every bottle purchased, you will be granted one admission to the Private Barrel Selection Event, to be held on a Monday evening at a date to be determined. Members will sample three (3) Knob Creek 9 Year Old, 120-Proof Single Barrel Bourbons from three (3) different barrels. Complimentary small plates to enjoy with your samples will be provided as well.

•Each member will be able to cast one vote for every bottle they have pre-purchased. The barrel that receives the most votes will be the one that is bottled especially for us.

•Once the bottles arrive from the distillery, each buyer may redeem their voucher for a hand-numbered bottle with the Franklin Hotel Bar logo printed on it that they can request whenever they patronize the Franklin Hotel Bar. Their Knob Creek may be requested neat, on ice, as an Old Fashioned or as a Manhattan at no charge  for themselves or their guests whenever they stop in, for the duration of their bottle.

•Once the bottle has been finished, the empty limited-edition custom bottle will be presented to the Barrel Club Buyer as a keepsake from the experience.

 

Don't let the price tag dissuade you: a typical bottle of Knob Creek Single Barrel yields approximately 17, 1.5oz, servings. At a by-the-drink price of $12, an entire bottle ala carte would cost $204 total.  For your investment you get to attend the selection event, drink a fantastic, ultra-rare, bourbon at a reduced cost, and take home your limited-edition bottle as a keepsake.

Please note that the alcohol is for consumption exclusively at the Franklin Hotel Bar and not allowed to be removed from the premises for any reason. The alcohol must be consumed within guidance of State Of Ohio Liquor Laws. Both purchasers and recipients of the alcohol must be 21 years of age or older.

story:
We wanted to create a travel coffee system that was convenient, durable and also sustainable. Out of these desires, FLTRgo was born...

 

Below is a list of design choices and decisions that were made to ensure the FLTRgo is an amazing coffee filter perfect for travel and also good for the planet. 

1. Bamboo: The FLTRgo ring and handle are made with bamboo, an extremely sustainable resource which is as strong as steel so you don't have to worry about it breaking in your bag while traveling. Additionally, it conducts very little heat so you don't need to worry about burning your fingers.

2. Cotton: With proper cleaning our organic non-GMO cotton filter can be used hundred of times. Its extremely tight weave is perfect for filtering coffee.

3. Hinge Design: We wanted to make the FLTRgo as portable as possible and with our hinged handle design it can fold up and fit inside your pant pocket or bag easily.

-------

PROTOTYPE REVIEW (VIDEO): Obviously we think the FLTRgo is great, but we also created a few prototypes which we sent out to influencers on YouTube. Check out the video below from Tim @ EverydayTacticalVids as he took his filter on a camping adventure!

 

 

ZERO WASTE: Paper coffee filters can only be used once and typically aren't accepted by recycling centers, meaning they end up in landfills. With FLTRgo, our filter can be re-used hundreds of times, with proper care - lessening the environmental impact of your cup of coffee. 

 

As much as we are committed to a great cup of coffee and to travel adventures, we are also committed to ethical and environmental responsibility. That is why we are sourcing our organic cotton through fair trade channels and are working to make transparency in our supply chain a priority.

Organic cotton is better for the environment, for farmers, for textile manufacturing workers, and for the consumer. Our sourcing partners are certified by Global Organic Textile Standard (GOTS), the top standard for textiles made from organic fibers worldwide. GOTS requirements include environmental standards along the entire supply chain of organic textiles and fair trade social criteria as well. "All phases of organic fiber and fabric production must be inspected and certified according to GOTS' strict, uniform standards in order to obtain the certification label 'organic.'"

The certification outlet our suppliers use is OneCert. OneCert not only certifies by GOTS standards but also six other standards including the National Organic Program-USDA. Their process includes on-site inspections.

We are also using food-grade bamboo (used for cutting boards and kitchen utensils) for the ring and handle. Bamboo is highly sustainable and good for the environment. "Bamboo’s fast growth rate and high productivity results in significant volumes of fiber produced per area." Bamboo plantations restore degraded land and reduce deforestation through the provision of a sustainable source of fiber. (http://www.ecoplanetbamboo.com/about-us) 

 

Here is the story behind the FLTRgo...

My wife and I work online and are full-time digital nomads (34 countries on five continents in the last two years), run the travel blog Uncontained Life, and are coffee fanatics. In our adventures, particularly outside of city centers, we had difficulty finding a good cup (or four) of coffee. We did find espresso drinks but we prefer filtered coffee.

I started looking for a product I could take with me, but, French Presses, V60 drips, Aeropress, and other coffee makers are bulky, heavy, or require disposable filters. I started thinking about how to make a filter that was reusable, lightweight, could make multiple cups of coffee, and took up very little space in my luggage.

In June of 2016, we flew to Rio De Janeiro, Brazil, and were offered a cup of coffee from from the host of our accommodations. I watched as he boiled water, added coffee grounds,and then poured the coffee through what looked like a sock! Luckily it wasn’t a sock. It was a fabric filter on a wire ring. When I asked my host where he got the filter, he sent me to an eclectic shop in Rio’s Chinatown where they sold plumbing supplies, electronics, and these fabric coffee filters. I bought a dozen.

While these filters met the basic requirements for making filtered coffee, they had a few drawbacks. The fabric quality was not so good, which affected the taste of the coffee. The stitching fell apart after awhile. The wire ring was not very strong and would bend under the weight of coffee and water and become warped during travel.

I thought to myself, “I think I can make something better than this!”

And, over the next few months, I did.

 

Here are the different perks available when you become a FLTRgo contributor on Indiegogo.

 

Risks and Challenges

There is no doubt that FLTRgo will face obstacles. At every step of the design, prototyping, patent process, and marketing, we faced challenges. But for every speed bump we encountered, we used three simple principles: 1) Name the problem; 2) Identify the solution; 3) Utilize the correct people to reach the goal. These three principles also work for anticipating future risks and challenges.

We have partners that specialize in overseas sourcing, manufacturing, and logistics. We will continue to work alongside our partners in the coming weeks, with the goal to move forward with the manufacturing and shipping of the first FLTRgo production.

There are, of course, some things that are out of our control. The lead time (how long it takes to produce and ship the products) would increase commensurate with the success of the crowdfunding campaign. Of course, we will continue to communicate with our contributors along the way, and will work tirelessly to deliver the filters by the estimated delivery date in February 2018.

story:
Slice of Sauce™ transforms the traditional condiment aisle with individual “slices” of Signature Recipe Ketchup in a convenient and mess-free package of 8 portions.  We are NOT individually wrapped.

Layer it onto your burgers, sandwiches, wraps and more for a delicious burst of flavor and a perfectly portioned bite every time. 

                  

• Slice of Sauce™ is an update to ordinary condiments. The slice is a tantalizing layer of flavor and lets you enjoy a perfect bite every time.

• We’ve got a clean label. Our ingredients are non-GMO, gluten-free, all-natural with no artificial flavors, preservatives, or high-fructose corn syrup.

                      

• It’s so easy to add a slice. There’s no sticky mess or soggy bread, no “liquidy” separation and no uneven squeezing from a part-empty bottle like with many traditional condiments.

• Take it anywhere. Slice of Sauce™ needs no refrigeration, so it’s great for lunchboxes, picnics, barbeques, hiking and camping, lunches at your desk or eating on the go.

We were working with some family recipes given to us by Emily’s father, a restaurateur from the Upper Peninsula of Michigan. A recipe for BBQ sauce called for braising loads of vegetables and then discarding them. In order to use as much of the whole ingredients as possible, we mixed them, ground them, and dried them. Accidentally, the result was Slice of Sauce™.

The base for that BBQ sauce was ketchup, but traditional condiments are packed with preservatives and high fructose corn syrup. Instead, we wanted to focus on using healthy, high quality ingredients so we knew we needed our own recipe. After experimenting with different flavors and our new-found "slice" process, we ended up with a Signature Recipe Ketchup that adds a delicious layer to anything from burgers and wraps to sandwiches and burritos.  

                                           

Our Founder Emily hails from the Upper Peninsula of Michigan and has a background in finance, sales, and supply chain management. She grew up in a small snowy town where her Midwestern upbringing included baking bread with her dad and playing the fiddle with her mom’s bluegrass band.   

Co-Founder Thac has an MBA in finance and spent over 15 years building successful retail businesses in Los Angeles and New York City. After leaving his job and backpacking around the world, Thac returned to LA and partnered with Emily to join the Slice Age. 

Today, Emily is the CEO and Chief Flavor Innovator, and Thac is the CFO and Executive Spreadsheet Wizard.  

                       

We set out to share our passion for healthy living and our love of food. We want to spread awareness that products with clean labels and ingredients with integrity can also be fun.  We are deeply committed to leading the way in sustainable packaging and regenerative sourcing.

Slice of Sauce™ began in our homes but we’re excited to bring it to the shelves of grocery stores everywhere. In addition, we hope Slice of Sauce™ will address a need for healthier alternatives in schools, hospitals, and the military.

story:
Challenges and Opportunity

We believe that food and farming have an incredible capacity to transform and heal. We have seen the effect that working in the soil has had on people who’ve been disconnected from it. We have experienced the joy and transformation that come when people eat lovingly grown food prepared with great care. We have worked to build stronger, more engaged communities through food and farming. We know the improved health benefits that come with a more natural, less processed, and nutritionally balanced diet.

We have the opportunity to create a more just and representational food system. As a farm with women, intergenerational, interracial, and queer and straight owners, focused on building an equitable business, we hope to model a new possibility in the world of farming. A justice based farm that is financially sustainable, and shares what we learn and do to continue to build a more representational food movement.

We are ready to take the next step in building this model - a community kitchen, just down the road from our farm. The kitchen will allow us to host more classes near the farm, both during the growing season, and beyond. It will enable us to grow the diversity of products we create, including drying herbs for teas and herb salts, a greater range of fermented food products, and traditionally canned items. It will be a resource for other local farmers and local food based businesses to use to create value added products. And we will partner with our neighboring business, The Green Onion, to host events, dances, retreats and more for all the communities we serve.

Who we are

We are Rise & Root Farm, a 3 acre collectively run farm located in the famous and fertile black dirt of Chester, NY. We grow vegetables, flowers, and herbs using sustainable growing methods. In addition to being farmers, we are educators, community organizers and food entrepreneurs with deep roots in New York City and an unwavering commitment to engaging rural and urban communities through food and farming. Collectively we have decades of farming and gardening experience, both rural and in the city. We are committed to increasing opportunities for all people to grow and eat good food.

Among us are founders, teachers, and the former Director of New York City’s Farm School NYC, three graduates of the internationally acclaimed Ecological Horticulture Apprenticeship program at the Center for Agroecology and Sustainable Food Systems (CASFS), a 2014 James Beard Leadership Award recipient, founders of Black Urban Growers, a Gramercy Tavern chef alum, and the Founder and Chef of Crock & Jar. In 2012, our farm team participated in Grow NYC's Farm Beginnings program, developing our farm vision and business plan, which includes a commercial kitchen space. In 2015, we launched our first Indiegogo fundraiser, reached our funding goal, and have been running our farm successfully for a year and a half. Now it's time to grow.

With our collective knowledge, skills and experience working with food from seed to table, we are creating a farm that reflects our values for growing ethically and sustainably on the land while providing healthy food and healing experiences to our communities and growing a strong local food economy.  

Our Team Includes:

(to learn more about each click on their name, or scroll to the end of this page)


Jane Hodge
Karen Washington
 

Lorrie Clevenger
Michaela Hayes
 

How We’ll Make This Happen Together (What We Need & What You Get)

Our goal for this campaign is $10,000, with a stretch goal of $20,000. Our budget to build out and equip the kitchen space is $45,000. We have already secured a low interest loan of $25,000, so the funds we raise through this campaign will help us close the gap.

The money will help us pay for reconstruction of an existing barn into a commercially certified kitchen. The barn hasn’t been used since 1999 and previously held a farm market. The infrastructure is sound, and it has power and town water. We will build out the interior of the space, putting in functioning bathrooms, walls, plumbing and gas lines. We will add in windows for lighting and finish the second floor as a drying area with a fan. We will equip the space with sinks, stoves, a fermentation walk-in cooler and standard walk-in coolers, preservation equipment such as dehydrators and canning equipment, tables and chairs for classes, and storage shelves for neighbors who rent the kitchen. The costs for the buildout are estimated at $20,000 with the equipment estimated at an additional $25,000.

When you help us plant the seeds to grow the kitchen space, your harvest will be bountiful. Everyone who donates $25 or more will receive a kitchen magnet and have their name added to a donor sign in the kitchen. For higher donations, additional perks include an invitation to a grand opening party, free classes, the opportunity to have one of our products named after you or someone you love, a private label product for your event, host your event at the kitchen space, and more. And most importantly, your contribution is a chance to feel great about the fact that you are making a real difference in strengthening the roots of our farm and helping us continue the work that we are doing.

The Impact

In the first season and a half of our farm, we have done a lot to build a better food landscape. With the kitchen space, we will build on this existing work: creating healthy food products; hosting more classes and events in our local community; creating new partnerships around education and employment opportunities; reinvigorating the downtown of our new home in the Village of Chester; and building a welcoming, safe space to experience, learn, grow, and heal around farming and cooking.

Here's some of what we've done so far:

  • Growing organically with an eye to our ecosystem - We are transitioning the land from conventional agriculture to organic. We choose varieties of plants that will encourage beneficial insects, and we discourage pests through crop rotation, flower plantings, and row covers.  We are pleased to see that in our second season there are far more pollinators and other insects present.
  • Providing fresh produce to a variety of communities - We sell our food and flowers at two markets in New York City - La Familia Verde, a community market in the Bronx, and Union Square, in the heart of Manhattan. We also sell closer to the farm in Goshen, NY. We strive to create a balance of markets so we can provide fresh food for all communities.
  • Hosting healing work days - individuals come to the farm and work beside us in the soil. We talk, listen to the birds and frogs, taste plants, and enjoy a lunch together where we talk about the work we are doing and why.
  • Partnering with the local food pantry - located in the kitchen of the Chester Presbyterian Church, we create nutritious dishes that highlight the fresh produce available at the monthly pantry. We encourage people to taste how the fresh produce can be used and take it home to try it themselves.
  • Collaborating with food justice and educational organizations - Through classes, workshops, tours, and pop-up events in NYC or on the farm, we continue to build connections within the farming and food justice community and the broader communities we serve. Some of these organizations include: such as Farm School NYC, Just Food, Northeast Atlantic Marine Alliance, The Youth Farm, International Rescue Committee, Mary Mitchell Center, and more.

Risks & Challenges

One of the major risks involved in farming is weather. The kitchen space will allow us to mitigate some of this risk by creating diversified revenue that is less weather dependent.

The major risk for the kitchen is taking on additional fixed monthly expenses including rent and utilities. We will manage risk through diverse streams of revenue. In addition to making value-added products (products that add value to crops grown in the field) ourselves, we will rent the kitchen space to other farmers and local food producers. We will create a shared kitchen that specializes in fermented food products - something that does not exist in New York state. We will also host classes - both agricultural, culinary, and justice based - and events, both food and cultural.

All four owners of the farm are teachers. Collectively we’ve taught for Farm School NYC, the Center for Agroecology and Sustainable Food Systems at UCSC, the Natural Gourmet Institute, Just Food, and for a myriad of local, regional and national food and farming organizations. Our connections to each other and our communities are what make us strong. We will draw on those connections as much as we work to build them - to ensure that this next step of our farm dream is successful.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is in a position to contribute to our campaign with money. Even if you don’t donate, there are still great ways that we can build this thing together:

  • Spread the word! Share this campaign to your friends and followers on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, etc. Share with your loved ones and help us grow this network.
  • Donate your services: if you have construction, plumbing, electrical, painting or other building skills, let us know if you’d like to raise this kitchen in a physical way.
  • Donate stuff: we need a lot of equipment and supplies to make this kitchen happen. If you have prep tables, metro shelving, plywood, sheetrock, tools, paint, nails, stoves, etc. we can probably use it. See our website for a longer list of things we can use at the farm.
  • Spread the word! We can’t emphasize this one enough. If you tell your friends and they tell their friends, and so on, we really start to build something super cool.

More about our team:

Lorrie Clevenger - In addition to being a farmer, Lorrie is an educator and organizer around food and justice, co-founding the Black Urban Growers and co-founding Farm School NYC. In 2014, she returned from two seasons at the Center for Agroecology and Sustainable Food Systems (CASFS), where she taught more than 30 apprentices at the farm & garden. Lorrie is also a teacher for Farm School NYC and through her work with BUGS partners with the Bard Prison Initiative in offering a re-entry program focused on Urban Agriculture and Community Leadership Development.

Michaela Hayes - As a chef and farmer, Michaela brings her culinary expertise to the farm. She's the Founder and Chef of Crock & Jar, whose products have been Good Food Award finalists three years in a row. She cooked for years in NYC restaurants including Gramercy Tavern, where she founded their pickling program. Michaela is a co-founder and teacher for Farm School NYC.  She is also the co-founder of NYC Ferments, a monthly meetup group for the fermentation community. When she is not growing or preserving food, Michaela is also a talented food writer and stylist.

Jane Hodge - As the founding Director of Farm School NYC, Jane helped to train residents in urban agriculture by growing food, leaders, and community in NYC. She received a Certificate in Ecological Horticulture from the Center for Agroecology and Sustainable Food Systems (CASFS). Before starting Rise & Root Farm, Jane farmed at Obercreek Farm, Snug Harbor Heritage Farm, and Roxbury Farm.

Karen Washington - Dubbed "Urban Farming's Grand Dame" by the New York Times, Karen spent the last few decades founding, working with, and mentoring countless community gardens across New York City. Because of her ability to inspire others around growing food, she received the 2014 James Beard Leadership award. Karen has been a backyard and community gardener for decades, and she received a Certificate in Ecological Horticulture from  the Center for Agroecology and Sustainable Food Systems (CASFS). Karen is also co-founder of Black Urban Growers and Farm School NYC.
story_txt:
Challenges and Opportunity
We believe that food and farming have an incredible capacity to transform and heal. We have seen the effect that working in the soil has had on people who’ve been disconnected from it. We have experienced the joy and transformation that come when people eat lovingly grown food prepared with great care. We have worked to build stronger, more engaged communities through food and farming. We know the improved health benefits that come with a more natural, less processed, and nutritionally balanced diet.
We have the opportunity to create a more just and representational food system. As a farm with women, intergenerational, interracial, and queer and straight owners, focused on building an equitable business, we hope to model a new possibility in the world of farming. A justice based farm that is financially sustainable, and shares what we learn and do to continue to build a more representational food movement.
We are ready to take the next step in building this model - a community kitchen, just down the road from our farm. The kitchen will allow us to host more classes near the farm, both during the growing season, and beyond. It will enable us to grow the diversity of products we create, including drying herbs for teas and herb salts, a greater range of fermented food products, and traditionally canned items. It will be a resource for other local farmers and local food based businesses to use to create value added products. And we will partner with our neighboring business, The Green Onion, to host events, dances, retreats and more for all the communities we serve.

story:
Short Summary

After a successful first year at lauded soba restaurant Kamonegi, Chef Mutsuko Soma and fellow sake sommelier Russell King will open Hannyatou, a sake bar and retail shop to highlight unique, specialized sake along with promoting sake education and enjoyment in Seattle. Hannyatou will also boast a bar menu highlighting traditional fermentation techniques that have been practiced for generations, creating seasonal small dishes meant to enhance the sake experience. Hannyatou will open in the former Lama G Cafe space, two doors down from Kamonegi, and will seat about 20 people along with additional patio seating in the Spring and Summer months.

What We Need & What You Get

We’re happy to announce that we have secured the Hannyatou space, one close enough to Kamonegi with hopes of providing a different experience and perhaps a waiting spot to enjoy small bites and sake before securing your table at Kamonegi. Your support will help provide funds to fix up the intimate patio space for the Spring and Summer months and renovate the space. Hannyatou is a small space, and we hope to install an awning or shade over the patio and purchase heat lamps so we can continue to utilize the space on fair weather days; sounds crazy, but there’s nothing quite like sake on a grey drizzly day.

The Impact

In the last few years, the enjoyment and production of sake in western markets have grown exponentially making sake a top contender with other spirits and even wine in restaurants. Such growth has led to more local sake brewers and a diverse array of sake being introduced to western markets. Despite its growing popularity, we are still limited in places and retail options where one can obtain and experience a wide range of sakes from the classic, clean Junmai Daigingo to more eccentric varieties utilizing new rice strains or varietal flower yeasts. We aim to provide a space through Hannyatou for producers and brewers to showcase new products and for guests grow from casual sake drinkers to true enthusiasts.

Risks & Challenges

While restaurant and bar openings are always a challenging endeavor, we ask for your support to minimize our risk. Your support will be an added safeguard that will allow us to address all necessary changes to the space, which may otherwise have to address gradually as we acquire the funds. What this means is that we will be able to start work on the most challenging aspects of the space which includes clean up, renovation, and weather proofing of our space and patio. This head start, particularly in our first year of opening, will lend to our success, longevity, and greater ability to service the local community.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you wish to donate any amount of your choice without expectation of perks, we happily and humbly accept your generosity. We thank you in advance for your generous donation and support. Please also help us spread the word about and campaign! Follow us on social media and stop by when we open!

story:
From guilty to healthy pleasure.

I'm Katarina Verhaegen from Chocolat Essentiel, a Belgian based innovative chocolatier. My mission is to make delicious organic & healthy cocoa products, healthy enough to even enter the pharmacies. We achieved this goal in Belgium! We are available in more than 90% of the pharmacies, premium wellness places, fine delicacies stores and concept stores.

 Now we are ready to expand to Europe!

I founded the company 3 years ago; I'm a medical engineer with a passion for chocolate making and beekeeping. Prof. Dr. Walter Luyten, president of the company devoted his career to research of drug discovery with a passion for natural medicines.  We teamed up with Isabelle De Vos, who’s in charge of marketing and branding, and she makes it all happen.

This campaign is important to us as we are preparing to expand internationally. It is our goal to ensure our products become available in Europe. Unfortunately, due to last year's happenings, it was impossible to attend international fairs and contact a global audience. That's why we are now reaching out to you! This way we can track the interest in our products in your country.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need 22.000 EUR to expand to each new country. This includes finding a trustworthy distributor, new packaging and communication materials. Our goal is to grow to at least 4 new countries before autumn 2021. Please, join us in this adventure and support us!

We are thrilled to send you our products as unique perks in return for all this. In addition, we have selected a customized offer for the Indiegogo community. Due to the pure cocoa we use, all our chocolates support the brain & immunity functions, are fatigue and age fighters, and are skin and hair beauty boosters all at once. This is due to the source of iron, chromium and copper.

Perks of Taste

Let's introduce you to our 6 new flavors... Whether you're a flower lover or a taste connoisseur, our chocolates can fill your daily needs to be surprised! Lemon, Mandarin, Ginger, Peppermint, Pine & Jasmine.

Perks of Wellness

Moreover, the essential oils used (lemon, mandarin, ginger, peppermint, pine & jasmine) are traditionally used for their mood-enhancing properties. We’ve selected personalized wellness boxes; HAPPY, our mood enhancer - LOVE, the natural aphrodisiac - PEACE, a natural digestive aid and BREATH, the immunity booster.

Other Ways You Can Help Us 

We hope you got excited about our products and welcome them to your country. We'd love to! Is there a traditional aromatic treatment in your region or country? Let us know! Let's imagine a food pairing with Belgian chocolate in a compelling way. We also welcome all support to help us to find a distribution network. We are a small company with big plans and can use all the help in the world!

 

 

 

 

Chocolat Essentiel brings tradition & science together.

The history of chocolate goes back to the Aztecs. They used roasted cocoa beans, honey and spices to prepare a drink to increase their energy. Inspired by the deep knowledge of these traditions and contemporary science, Chocolat Essential creates natural and sweet delights beneficial for the body and mind.

 

Organic & clean label

Each praline is made of 100% pure organic cocoa, acacia honey, fruit and essential oil. The perfect combination and dosage of these four ingredients hold the secret to its beneficial effects and unique taste. And, of course, banning all other additions.

Sustainable production & packaging

We prepare our chocolates according to a world-renowned Belgian tradition in our atelier powered by hydroelectricity. And our packaging consists primarily of cocoa shells, a by-product of chocolate processing.

 

 

A 100% natural food supplement

Our 100% pure cacao is a natural source of - amongst others - iron, copper and chromium. That's why our chocolates support the immune system, improve memory function and reduce fatigue. They also contribute to skin and hair health and have antioxidant properties.

The essential oils, carefully added to the filling, give a natural and pleasant taste and provide additional beneficial effects known in traditional medicine.

The chocolates are recognized as a food supplement, so you can also take them as a cure.


The daily recommended intake is 4 chocolates. This amount is a natural source of iron (38%*), copper (136%*) and chromium (53%*) and has an energy value of 716 kJ (171 kCal). *of the daily recommended intake based on an 8400 kJ diet. Ingredients: 72% non-EU cocoa**, acacia honey** LEMON blueberry**(Vaccinium corymbosum L., freeze-dried) and Citrus limon essential oil**(0.4%) MANDARIN , blueberry**(Vaccinium corymbosum L., freeze-dried) and Citrus limon essential oil**(0.4%)  GINGER Zingiber officinale essential oil** (0,2%) PEPPERMINT sweet orange**(Citrus sinensis (L.) Osbeck, lyophilized) and Mentha x piperita essential oil**(0,15%) PINE Pinus sylvestris essential oil** (0,05%) JASMINE balsamic vinegar** and Jasminum officinale essential oil (0,05%) (**certified organic ingredients)

Allergens: may contain traces of milk, nuts and gluten. Precautions: keep out of reach of children. Do not administer to children under 6 years of age. Do not use during pregnancy or lactation. Not as a substitute for a balanced diet and a healthy lifestyle. Do not exceed the recommended dosage. Keep cool (12-20°C), dry and dark.

This is due to the source of iron, chromium and copper.
Perks of Taste
Let's introduce you to our 6 new flavors... Whether you're a flower lover or a taste connoisseur, our chocolates can fill your daily needs to be surprised! Lemon, Mandarin, Ginger, Peppermint, Pine & Jasmine.

Perks of Wellness
Moreover, the essential oils used (lemon, mandarin, ginger, peppermint, pine & jasmine) are traditionally used for their mood-enhancing properties. We’ve selected personalized wellness boxes; HAPPY, our mood enhancer - LOVE, the natural aphrodisiac - PEACE, a natural digestive aid and BREATH, the immunity booster.

Other Ways You Can Help Us 
We hope you got excited about our products and welcome them to your country. We'd love to! Is there a traditional aromatic treatment in your region or country? Let us know! Let's imagine a food pairing with Belgian chocolate in a compelling way. We also welcome all support to help us to find a distribution network. We are a small company with big plans and can use all the help in the world!
 

 
 
 
Chocolat Essentiel brings tradition & science together.

The history of chocolate goes back to the Aztecs. They used roasted cocoa beans, honey and spices to prepare a drink to increase their energy. Inspired by the deep knowledge of these traditions and contemporary science, Chocolat Essential creates natural and sweet delights beneficial for the body and mind.
 
Organic & clean label
Each praline is made of 100% pure organic cocoa, acacia honey, fruit and essential oil. The perfect combination and dosage of these four ingredients hold the secret to its beneficial effects and unique taste. And, of course, banning all other additions.

Sustainable production & packaging
We prepare our chocolates according to a world-renowned Belgian tradition in our atelier powered by hydroelectricity. And our packaging consists primarily of cocoa shells, a by-product of chocolate processing.

 
 
A 100% natural food supplement
Our 100% pure cacao is a natural source of - amongst others - iron, copper and chromium. That's why our chocolates support the immune system, improve memory function and reduce fatigue. They also contribute to skin and hair health and have antioxidant properties.
The essential oils, carefully added to the filling, give a natural and pleasant taste and provide additional beneficial effects known in traditional medicine.
The chocolates are recognized as a food supplement, so you can also take them as a cure.
The daily recommended intake is 4 chocolates. This amount is a natural source of iron (38%*), copper (136%*) and chromium (53%*) and has an energy value of 716 kJ (171 kCal). *of the daily recommended intake based on an 8400 kJ diet. Ingredients: 72% non-EU cocoa**, acacia honey** LEMON blueberry**(Vaccinium corymbosum L., freeze-dried) and Citrus limon essential oil**(0.4%) MANDARIN , blueberry**(Vaccinium corymbosum L., freeze-dried) and Citrus limon essential oil**(0.4%)  GINGER Zingiber officinale essential oil** (0,2%) PEPPERMINT sweet orange**(Citrus sinensis (L.) Osbeck, lyophilized) and Mentha x piperita essential oil**(0,15%) PINE Pinus sylvestris essential oil** (0,05%) JASMINE balsamic vinegar** and Jasminum officinale essential oil (0,05%) (**certified organic ingredients)
Allergens: may contain traces of milk, nuts and gluten. Precautions: keep out of reach of children. Do not administer to children under 6 years of age. Do not use during pregnancy or lactation. Not as a substitute for a balanced diet and a healthy lifestyle. Do not exceed the recommended dosage. Keep cool (12-20°C), dry and dark.

story:
Say hello to NE Minneapolis’ newest brewery. Falling Knife Brewing Co. occupies a 7,400-square-foot space with a 20-barrel brewhouse and 149-person full-service taproom, including a dedicated pinball alley. 16 taps will showcase a wide array of beers produced exclusively on premise, and include a spectrum of styles and flavors that will appeal to a multitude of patrons.


“We didn’t realize it at the time, but this project started with listening to bands we love and drinking beer at venues around the Twin Cities.” said CEO Andy Rutledge. “That bond eventually progressed into serious conversations about starting a brewery together, which is now becoming Falling Knife Brewing Company.”


Rutledge is joined by Tom Berg and Dan Herman, both longtime veterans of the beer and service industries. Berg was a nationally decorated homebrewer and BJCP beer judge who brewed commercially at Wicked Wort and has collaborated at several other Twin Cities breweries, including Venn Brewing Company, Back Channel Brewing, Flat Earth Brewing and Day Block Brewing. Herman has nearly 20 years of hospitality experience and is acknowledged for his accomplishments at service-focused restaurants like Kincaids and Tilia.


“Time is the most valuable commodity people can give. When someone trusts us with the free time they have, we will respond with outstanding beer and a phenomenal experience,” said Herman.

Berg was a nationally decorated homebrewer and BJCP beer judge who brewed commercially at Wicked Wort and has collaborated at several other Twin Cities breweries, including Venn Brewing Company, Back Channel Brewing, Flat Earth Brewing and Day Block Brewing. Herman has nearly 20 years of hospitality experience and is acknowledged for his accomplishments at service-focused restaurants like Kincaids and Tilia.“Time is the most valuable commodity people can give. When someone trusts us with the free time they have, we will respond with outstanding beer and a phenomenal experience,” said Herman.

story:
People love cookies.

I am a cookie baker.

I want to bring my cookies to people. And I have done so numerous times before.

What Cookies Are You Making?

This time around, I've decided to offer the three most popular cookies I've made, which can be viewed below:

If I buy these cookies, when will they arrive?

With these campaign, I've decided to extend the fundraising period from 30 to 45 days so the week after the campaign is through, roughly around May 19, I will start baking and by or before May 23.

Shipping is done via USPS using 2-day priority shipping.

To Josh Howell who I commissioned the art from.

story:
Summary

For some time now Jerrel Goins and I (Chris Ehorn) have wanted to open our own Ice Cream shop. Not just any Ice Cream shop though. One that combines ORGANIC cream with LIQUID NITROGEN to create a FRESH ice cream right before your eyes! I bet you didn’t even know ice cream could be fresh. We want to open it in beautiful down town San Diego where I live. We want to stand out even more by having nothing but the best flavors by using fresh fruit, homemade cookie dough, etc. We want to support local business also by buying our fruits from local markets, getting our chocolate and caramels from family owned businesses and so forth. We want everyone to benefit. We thought about going with investors on this, but ones we have spoken with want to do things their way, and the cheap quick way. We want it to be not just a great show by seeing the ice cream made right in front of you, but we want you to love the taste so it keeps you wanting more. We want our providers to want and enjoy doing business with us. We want people to make it an event coming to Sempre Dolce so they can experience this liquid nitrogen organic ice cream. Having lived in Italy for two years, I've eaten my fair share of gelato, the best ice cream you can get, and I know what makes people happy. We want to have those unique flavors that are loved so much, that separate us from every other ice cream parlor.  

What We Need & What You Get

We have our business plan and know that we need to raise $60,000 to get things up and running so we can open up right away. We already have a location right accross the street from Petco Park were the Padres play! Its in a prime location, but we need your help to secure it. Also your contributions will go to us getting the equipment that is needed to make gallons upon gallons of liquid nitrogen ice cream everyday.  We need your support to get this done. We are going to give back in more ways than one. not just directly back to you as you will see in our perks section, but also to those that need it most.

The Impact

We saw this not just as a great business opportunity, or a way to make the most exciting organic ice cream, but a way we can give back to those that need it most. For example, during national breast cancer awareness month, we will donate 5% to the American Cancer Society, as well as have pink ice cream cups, spoons, and napkins to raise awareness. It is something that has touched us and our families personally and we want to help. Also having a wife that works as a radiation therapist and works with cancer patients daily, it is something we feel strongly about. We have many more ideas when it comes to ways to help, whether it’s to help those less fortunate, sick, or struggling, we will find ways to help.

Other Ways You Can Help

Anything you can contribute helps. Even if its word of mouth. You can direct people to our page by posting our url on your Facebook, twitter, or even myspace (we wont judge you for that). Share our video and page with the world.

story:
*** We have completed shipments to all our backers as of December 5th! Here are a couple of videos and pictures to show what we have shipped ***


What's in the K-Mometer Box?
 

Demo of Final K-Mometer

 

 

*** We're excited to announce that we have fulfilled K-Mometers for our early bird backers, just in time for Turkey Day, as promised and on schedule! Some have already received them and the rest are en route.  ***

Here are some pictures from the production line and shipping line. ;)

 


 

For those of you that need to cook a very large bird soon for Thanksgiving, this one's for you. Let's see how to cook the perfect turkey using the K-Mometer the first time, every time.
 

 

Want to see how to cook the perfect BBQ chicken with the K-Mometer? Check out this demonstration video:


What's the K-Mometer's accuracy? See our demo video as we perform the test using boiling water:


Check out our social media links and website:

Blog: https://konnectedwidgets.tumblr.com/
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/konnectedwidgets
Twitter: https://www.twitter.com/KWidgets
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/konnectallthewidgets/
Youtube Channel: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x8MJSry5MPs
Website: https://www.konnectedwidgets.com

 

What did we build?


A connected Wi-Fi thermometer that can take the heat! Competitor devices have issues such as:

  • Probe cabling that melts
  • Probes that stop working
  • Bad range
  • Random device disconnects

The K-Mometer is unique in its class because it uses an industry standard Type K thermocouple sensor and probe that is not only accurate, but can withstand extreme high-heat temperatures for extended periods of time. Need to cook a turkey for 7-8 hours? Smoke BBQ meats? No problem! You can also use it to make candy, like Marshmallows!

Our probe is made out of food grade (SS304) material which is food safe, and the probe cable is protected by a stainless steel sheath and stainless steel braid material, allowing you to monitor your food from start to finish. 

Check out this blog from Expression Food about using a thermometer for making the most beautiful meals: 
http://blog.expressionfood.com/thermometer-beautiful-meals/

Our Company and Product Vision
 


Please see the campaign gallery for more product and mobile app views. 

 

Use cases

  • Measure internal temperature of food such as roasts, grilled and smoked BBQ meats for safety and quality
  • ​Use as a candy thermometer (e.g. Monitor marshmallow syrup temperature)
  • Check oven temperature accuracy (some ovens are 30 degrees off!)
  • Check grill temperature for smoking BBQ

 

Hardware features

  • Standard Wi-Fi (2.4GHz 802.11/b/g/n) with Wi-Fi Protected Setup (WPS) push button setup. Connect directly to your existing Wi-Fi access point. No external hub required!
  • Industry standard Type K Thermocouple sensor and probe. The included probe supports up to 400 degrees Celsius or 752 Fahrenheit (the sensor itself can support wider temperature ranges, from -270 degrees C to 1372 degrees C)
  • Industry standard Type K panel connector for easy interchange of thermocouple probe for different application requirements
  • Built-in rechargeable battery that lasts up to 18 hours on a single full charge (can use while charging with external USB battery)
  • On/Off power switch for extending battery life when not in use
  • LED status indicators for battery charging and Wi-Fi activity

 

Mobile app features

  • Simple user interface for setting temperature settings and viewing current temperature readings
  • Notification alerts when desired temperature readings have been achieved
  • Data logging and graph view
  • Secure login and authentication with personal user account
  • Achievements and rewards
  • Over-the-air firmware updates
  • Support for iOS and Android 


Why did we build it?

We want you to be able to not only cook perfectly, but cook safely. 

Food borne illness is still a very big public health challenge in the United States alone. The CDC estimates that EVERY year there are 48 million cases resulting in 128,000 hospitalizations, and out of that unfortunately 3000 fatalities. This is really too much of a social problem to ignore and we can reduce these numbers dramatically and save lives if more households in America had the K-Mometer. 

The only way to TRULY know if your food is safe to eat is if you cook it to the exact internal temperature recommended by the USDA. For example, that’s 165 degrees Fahrenheit for turkey. Recent research has also shown that color and texture are not RELIABLE indicators of whether the food is truly done. If you don’t have this information, chances are you can get very sick, and of course that’s not a very good thing, especially if you have young children and/or seniors you’re taking care of.


It has to be fun and affordable too!

We want to help solve real world challenges with our connected devices, like the K-Mometer. The devices shouldn’t just be about the coolness factor. They should also address a real need. But how many times have you walked into Best Buy or Target or Walmart and said, "That looks like a cool gizmo but it’s way too pricey for me" … you get that sticker shock right? Our goal is to make these devices affordable so that everyone can have access to them, not just if you’re in the middle or upper class income range. The K-Mometer is only the first device in what we hope to be a pipeline of devices that will each help solve different challenges. 

Also, it should be fun to use. How many times have you used a gizmo for a few weeks and then it sits on the shelf? That’s why we’re also building a true rewards system into the mobile app. Collect points for using the K-Mometer on a regular basis and then redeem them for rewards later. 

So not only are you going to be ensuring that the food you cook tastes great, is safe, but you’ll have fun doing it.  


When are we delivering it?

The K-Mometer will be ready to ship in the Fall of 2017. The first 250 units will be ready to ship in November, followed by product delivery to our next 1000 backers in December. It will make a great Thanksgiving and Christmas gift this holiday season. You might ask, why such a quick turnaround? The reason is because the product is ready for mass production, and with your support we will quickly get it to thousands of people in time for the Holiday 2017 season. 

What will the funds be used for? 

  • Build-out and delivery of backer K-Mometer units
  • Product certifications
  • Fine tuning of the mobile app experience
  • Product packaging

 

About the team

  • Over 12 years of experience in the IoT domain, and 17 years of combined experience in wireless networking and semiconductors
  • Held product management, marketing, sales, and applications engineering posts for reputable companies such as Cypress Semiconductor, Texas Instruments, ARM, and Samsung SmartThings

 

Risks and Challenges

We are confident in meeting our anticipated delivery dates. Any unforeseen circumstances will be communicated via this project page to our backers with complete transparency.

**We are aware that there have been several projects that have been non-communicative about their progress and when units would be shipped to backers after many delays. Our promise is to provide honest and crisp responses about project and shipment updates. Please feel free to leave any comments with your questions and concerns and we will do our best to answer them comprehensively and straightforwardly.**

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
About The Sauce & Me

As a home cook who has always loved hot sauce, I was starting to get annoyed with the constant bombarding of gross-tasting heat in all these gimmicky sauces! All heat, no flavor and NEVER would you consider putting them on food.

I wanted something with flavor, depth, controlled and natural heat and a combination of flavors that hit different spots on the tongue. SO, my hot sauce was born!! 

Tropical Coffee Habanero is a blend of Mango, Espresso grounds and Habanero peppers! With all-natural ingredients, the sauce is 100% vegan and gluten-free.  

The sauce has been APPROVED by the Cornell Food Lab as shelf-stable and safe!

My goal is to make food that has ingredients you can pronounce, flavors you recognize and love, and no hesitancy due to lack of knowledge of these crazy ingredients other sauces use. 

Funding & Rewards

The funding that I am seeking is ONLY for the cost of health department inspections, courses, certifications, and licenses. ALL the things that NY makes you go through when you make a hot sauce. This money would allow me to be able to start selling online, at farmer's markets and to stores & restaurants. 

ANY DONATION AMOUNT IS WELCOME!

What you will get: 

$10+ higher pledge - 5 oz bottle of Tropical Coffee Habanero

$25+ pledge - 3 of the 5 oz bottles of Tropical Coffee Habanero

$50+ pledge - 6 of the 5 oz bottles of Tropical Coffee Habanero

I am only asking for the funds for licenses. I am not looking for everyone to fund this company, I want people to be able to still get my sauce in some way while I go through the rigorous and extensive process that NY state requires when you make something this acidic! 

This is a chance for you to support an independent business that could grow exponentially, and a chance for me to continue sharing my passion for good, clean and natural foods with the world!
story_txt:
About The Sauce & Me
As a home cook who has always loved hot sauce, I was starting to get annoyed with the constant bombarding of gross-tasting heat in all these gimmicky sauces! All heat, no flavor and NEVER would you consider putting them on food.
I wanted something with flavor, depth, controlled and natural heat and a combination of flavors that hit different spots on the tongue. SO, my hot sauce was born!! 
Tropical Coffee Habanero is a blend of Mango, Espresso grounds and Habanero peppers! With all-natural ingredients, the sauce is 100% vegan and gluten-free.  
The sauce has been APPROVED by the Cornell Food Lab as shelf-stable and safe!
My goal is to make food that has ingredients you can pronounce, flavors you recognize and love, and no hesitancy due to lack of knowledge of these crazy ingredients other sauces use. 
Funding & Rewards
The funding that I am seeking is ONLY for the cost of health department inspections, courses, certifications, and licenses. ALL the things that NY makes you go through when you make a hot sauce. This money would allow me to be able to start selling online, at farmer's markets and to stores & restaurants. 
ANY DONATION AMOUNT IS WELCOME!
What you will get: 
$10+ higher pledge - 5 oz bottle of Tropical Coffee Habanero
$25+ pledge - 3 of the 5 oz bottles of Tropical Coffee Habanero
$50+ pledge - 6 of the 5 oz bottles of Tropical Coffee Habanero
I am only asking for the funds for licenses. I am not looking for everyone to fund this company, I want people to be able to still get my sauce in some way while I go through the rigorous and extensive process that NY state requires when you make something this acidic! 
This is a chance for you to support an independent business that could grow exponentially, and a chance for me to continue sharing my passion for good, clean and natural foods with the world!

story:
Who is Good Boy?

Good Boy is not a single person or well-behaved animal. It is everyone that enjoys drinking quality wine ... accessible, authentic and appropriately imperfect. A wine to bring a friend's housewarming, pair with your partner's famous Khao Soi, or toss in a cooler and imbibe outside whilst watching the sun sink slowly into the mighty Pacific. 

In 2017 — and admittedly over a couple of hazy pints and fried chicken in an Echo Park dive — the thought hit us. Why is it that in most of western Europe you can't go two blocks without finding a wine that is reasonably priced, vibrant, balanced and shows an expression of place? While here in Los Angeles it is rare to find a locally made, fun and easy drinking wine.

After our second-ish beer, we decided it was time to look behind the smoke and mirrors of the industrialized winemaking industry and get back to basics in our home cellar. We set out to create a wine with little intervention and little knowledge, but heaps of passion.

And after a year of meeting with organic farmers in southern California, learning as much as possible from skilled natural winemakers, and reading more scientific texts with terms such as "anaerobic", "malolactic", "VvADH activity", we finally harvested and foot stomped our first vintage of Good Boy Wine in 2018.

 

Why an Indiegogo Campaign?

To make wine it takes a few things - Knowledge, Time & Grapes. Grapes definitely help. 

Now, we've got the knowledge on lock. And we have the time, but we need the grapes for our new vintage. For that, we need you. 

We've sourced 2 types of grapes from organic farmers in the Santa Ynez Valley. Although, as we have learned, organic farming is not easy work. We're committed to only sourcing unsprayed and unmodified grapes to make our wine. And it doesn't come cheap.

This is where you come in. We are not looking for donations, we are looking for partnerships. With every contribution, you will be receiving some wine in which without you, it wouldn't be possible to create. With your contribution, you become a Good Boy (or Girl of course), because honestly, at the start with any contribution, you become part of the family.

 

Our Goal

Our goal is to raise $7,500. With your support, we will be able to acquire the grapes, a couple of barrels, bottling equipment, and all the other necessities (bottles, corks, labels, etc) to grow our production.

As a big ol' thank you for your partners, we have some pretty nice perks, including an all you can eat, all you can drink backyard Bacchanalia!  After all, our goal is to not only make wine in Los Angeles but to build a supportive community of Good Boys and Girls that appreciate the finer, funkier, (and more sustainable) things in life.

Join us and together let's bring great natural wine to Los Angeles!

 -- Eric Bach & David Bourke

story:
Why Deep Steeps

Matt Bius had tea with an Austin tea master one day and it changed how he would look at tea forever. He discovered the style of Gongfu Cha, the art of cultivating the experience of tea and it was wonderful. He knew that he wanted to share this amazing experience with as many people as he could, so with his friend Justin Phillips, LAc. in tow he set out to create Deep Steeps; not just another tea crate, but a tea adventure! Bringing together the practice of Gongfu Cha, with incredible teas sourced from top tea importers, teaware, and education Deep Steeps helps every subscriber get the best out of their tea.

What We Need & What You Get

To reach a broader audience Deep Steeps needs to get their hands on enough great tea, teaware, and shipping materials to get the Gongfu Cha experience out to the world. That means start up. Our goal of $2500 will give us the ability to get enough of those things to get a first month up and running, which will then give us the ability to create a second month, and then a third, and so on. 

For helping us get started you get some great stuff. First off, you get a subscription to Deep Steeps which will include your first month (with later months auto-billed month to month if you like the service). This can be at our one tea per month, or our two teas per month level. For being one of our founding members you get a few extra things. We'll be running some behind the scenes fun like a Snapchat so you can watch the program you helped build grow, as well as keep up with all our fun tea-fueled shenanigans. You'll also be enrolled in our Founders Club which will entitle you to bonus teas and items periodically throughout the year, stuff no one else will ever be able to get!

More than anything what we want to do is help you feel like you're a part of this process. There is a real sense of community around Gongfu Cha, and for everyone that helps us make this dream real we want you to know that you will always be a part of our community!

Risks & Challenges

Our greatest challenge is just getting off the ground, but we can all overcome that together! One of the great things about a service like this is that even if we don't hit our full funding goal, we can still launch for the backers that supported us!

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate all our friends and tea lovers and recognize that not everyone can get involved with a monthly subscription. That's ok, please share this campaign, talk about it, hash tag us, and more! We would love to hear from you!

story:
The Handover Gin Story

Handover Gin has been in progress since 2014, when I took delivery of our first custom test equipment and built a small test lab in an unused unit upstairs from my apartment to work on the recipe for Handover Gin, including researching licensing, meeting with various government departments, and working closely with a consultant to confirm the requirements for setting up Hong Kong’s first craft distillery.

 

Since I’m originally from New Zealand, where it’s legal to make spirits for personal consumption, I’ve been producing spirits on a small scale for friends and family since I was eighteen, the past 4 years I have been traveling to the States to train as a Artisan Distiller 

Photo: Myself @ a Gin course in the States

 

The Gin

What once was British turns eastward and undergoes a reinvention.

Such is the story of Handover Gin, the first Hong Kong gin. We earned that distinction by building the first distillery in the Pearl of the Orient and then infusing the complexity of Hong Kong into every hand-crafted batch. Classic ginseng (人參) lends a luscious earthiness, balanced by the delicate citrus notes of bitter orange (酸橙). Chinese cinnamon (肉桂) has a warming effect, while the effects of horny goat weed (淫羊藿) are legendary. In all, eleven organic botanicals complement the fundamental essence of fresh juniper, resulting in a gin that honours a past tradition while establishing a new one.

This is gin by our rules. As rich and vibrant as the culture that inspired it, Handover Gin is the spirit of Hong Kong.

 

The Distillery (Hong Kong Distillery)

Our distillery is located in Tsuen Wan, Hong Kong. We have a 100 liter custom artisan Still with an eight-plate column for producing sample and small-batch spirit runs for local and international competitions.

 

Contributing Towards a Good Cause - Save the Pink Dolphin

Our “Save the Pink Dolphin” campaign combines our respect for the natural beauty of Hong Kong with the new consumer consciousness of environmental well-being.

With the sale of every bottle, we will donate to various local “Save the Pink Dolphin” foundations dedicated to protecting the rare and endangered Chinese Pink Dolphin that is found around Lantau Island. Whenever you drink Hong Kong Distillery products, you are helping to protect the rare wildlife of Hong Kong.

 

Our already award winning Gin

Our Handover Gin has already won Silver @ Cathay Pacific International Wine and Spirit for 2017 & 2018

SIlver 2017 & Silver 2018

 

The Perks

As a way of showing our appreciation for your support, we'd love to offer you some great perks and the opportunity.  We've customized our signature t-shirts to commemorate this occasion and to thank you for helping us launch Handover Gin.  We're also offering a special, behind the scenes look at the distillery with guided tours.  In addition to these limited time tours, we're also excited about our exclusive mixology event which will feature signature cocktails, and tasting made with Handover Gin.  Please check out the right of your screen for more amazing perks

 

Where, Exactly, Is the Money Going?

 

Funding Goal

Starting Hong Kong first distillery and producing award winning Gin isn't easy.  It requires top shelf distilling equipment, as well as extensive experience and professional knowledge. Fortunately, we’ve already accomplished most of this. We already have our custom made 100 litre Artisan Still and the facilities to produce. Now we need to start purchasing more botanicals and bottles, mixing tanks for our first production run  of our award winning Handover Gin

Stretch Goal #1

We've set a  stretch goal at $63,000, which will allow for the purchase of additional equipment enabling us to finalize R&D and begin production of our other spirits like Vodka, Rum and every Hongkongers favourite....Whisky, we can all drink to that, yes?

 

Risks & Challenges

In order to manufacture spirits, we have obtained various permits and licenses from the Hong Kong government. Each of these has had its own challenges. There is much red tape surrounding the production of alcohol in this region and we have worked with various parts of the Hong Kong government for four years to get this far in the process; our primary risk is delays on equipment manufacturing as most Distillery equipment is custom made  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Thought you'd never ask! Please share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter and E-mail using the Indiegogo tools at the top left of this page. The more we can spread the word about HongKong first Gin, the better we'll all be.
