story:
**STRETCH GOAL ACHIEVED!!**

With such an overwhelming response to our campaign, we introduced a stretch goal, and successfully smashed $200,000! With these additional funds, we will be able to build a rooftop residents’ bar at The DogHouse, serving a selection of the amazing sour beers brewed right next door! The following perks are now available to redeem! Get sharing it with your buddies!

Hello, we are BrewDog.

In 2007, BrewDog  was born on the rugged coast of North East Scotland. Over the past 10 years, we have grown to become UK's best selling craft beer, we export to 60 countries and we run 49 bars across the world. We started out with a mission to make other people as passionate about great craft beer as we are, and that's still our mission today.

Our first craft brewery in the US launched this year in Columbus, Ohio. We are now offering the opportunity to get involved in the world's first crowdfunded craft beer hotel, attached to a brand new sour beer facility, all located on our site in Columbus. 

By supporting this project, you will be staking your claim on one of our most ambitious projects to date. This hotel will provide a complete experiential environment in which to truly immerse yourself in the world of craft beer. From waking up to a view of our sour beer foeders and the smell of freshly mashed malt, to hop-infused spa treatments and beer breakfasts, and even amazing craft beer on tap in your bedroom - this hotel will have it all.

Why The DogHouse?

We want to create the top craft beer destination on the planet. Our brewery in Ellon, Scotland has become a destination for craft beer fans across Europe, and we want to build an even more amazing beer destination stateside. With The DogHouse focused on amazing craft beer from BrewDog and our favourite breweries worldwide, we're creating the ideal environment in which to immerse yourself in the ultimate beery weekend.

Forget Disneyland. This is the new happiest (or hoppiest) place on Earth.

Sour brewing provides the opportunity to experiment and innovate with the weirdest, most wonderful styles of beer the world has to offer. By building a dedicated sour beer facility on site at our brewery in Columbus, Ohio, we're setting ourselves up to start building some insane recipes without impacting on our day-to-day brewing. 
 

What We Need & What You Get

The BrewDog hotel & sour beer brewery will cost $6million to build and furnish, and the proceeds of this campaign will enable us to fast track the project through to completion. As you can see, the designs are well underway and we should have these finalized by June 2017. The build will then be accelerated in order for the hotel to be operational by Q3 2018. 



DogHouse will have craft beer at its core. We have already started work developing some craft beer spa treatments, with bespoke hop oils (to emulate your favorite beers) and malted barley massages, as well as a 'hoppy feet' pedicure to put a spring in your step before a brewery tour! Fully immerse yourself in the world of craft beer during your stay, enjoy craft beer infused breakfasts, lunches and dinners, with beers paired to every course. 



Our rooms will also all be themed around the world of BrewDog beer, with specialist suites that take you on a tour of our history, design, and passion that goes into every beer we make. We will also be installing shower beer fridges into our en suite rooms, so you're never more than arm's reach away from a chilled can of Punk IPA.

By backing our DogHouse and sour beer facility project, you'll unlock some amazing, money-can't buy perks and rewards that will elevate your visit to our brand new brewery and beer-themed hotel!

Read more about each perk and the items included on the pitch page. 

As well as being a part of the world's first fully-immersive craft beer hotel, you'll also be supporting the creation of 80 new jobs in the Columbus area, and further contributing to BrewDog's positive impact on the local area. 


 

Risks & Challenges

BrewDog owns the land on which we intend to construct The DogHouse, and we have established great connections with the City of Canal Winchester. The local authorities are fully supportive of our mission and goals in the region, and the brewery is located just 10 miles away from downtown Columbus with plenty of travel links on our doorstep. Although this will be our first hotel worldwide, we have an expert retail division with extensive experience in the hospitality and hotel industries.

Our 100,000 sq ft brewery is partially funded by 'Equity for Punks USA', via which we have raised $3.75million to date. You can join our global community of 55,000 craft beer renegade investors, and own a stake in BrewDog USA Inc. by buying shares right here.  

Provided we hit at least our minimum raise on Indiegogo, we have the balance of funds required in the profitability of the business to launch as per our timeline. All funds raised over the minimum will just allow us to move faster, and welcome you guys in before the general public!

The Team

BrewDog was launched in 2007 by James Watt and Martin Dickie. The pair set out on a mission to make other people as passionate about great craft beer as they were. Ten years later, they have together grown the business from brewing beers by hand in a garage in North East Scotland, to one of the world's most exciting craft breweries. James and Martin have recruited a crack team of ambitious, experienced individuals who make up 'Mission Control'. Here's the skinny on BrewDog's US senior team:

James Watt (Above, right)

Captain & Co-founder James Watt was a fully qualified deep sea Captain, having earlier completed an honours degree in Law & Economics. He traded in being a salty sea dog to become a BrewDog in 2007, pursuing his passion for great craft beer by setting up the company with Martin Dickie. James was awarded Great British Entrepreneur of the Year in 2014, and is one of only 13 Master Cicerones worldwide.

Martin Dickie (Above, left)

Beer Pirate & Co-founder Martin Dickie has a first class honours degree in Brewing & Distilling from Herriot Watt University. He is a renegade artist on a mission to change people’s perceptions about beer and challenge their tastebuds. Along with James, Martin hosts the hit international TV show Brew Dogs.



Allison Green (Above, top right)

People Director Ally joined BrewDog from B&M Retail (a FTSE 250 listed company) at the beginning of 2016 with the brief to make BrewDog the best employer. Ever. 

Neil Simpson (Above, bottom left)

Finance Director Neil Simpson joined BrewDog in August 2012 bringing with him over 20 years of experience, (10 of which were at partner level). Neil is a qualified chartered accountant with the Institute of Chartered Accountants in Scotland.

Tim Hawn (Above, top left)

Head of Production at BrewDog’s Columbus brewery is Tim Hawn. For the past nineteen years, Tim has brewed beers for Boston Beer Company and Pete’s Wicked Ales, as well as a large multinational brewer, and held the position of Brewmaster at Dogfish Head Craft Brewery.

David McDowall (Above, bottom right)

Retail Director David joined BrewDog PLC from G1 Group PLC, where he held the position of Group Operations Director for six years. He has experience managing over 50 sites and is responsible for overseeing the strategic growth and management of our global bar division.

Richard Kilcullen (not pictured)
Sour brewing expert, Richard joined the good ship BrewDog in early 2017 from Wicked Weed, where he held the position of Head of Sour Production. Richard will play an integral part in the set up of the sour beer facility in Columbus.

BrewDog
From our Scottish Head Quarters we export our beer into 60 countries worldwide, we have 49 amazing craft beer bars in 11 different countries, and our new brewery in Columbus Ohio is now open too. We are laser focused on two things as a business; beer and people. We are on a mission to make other people as passionate about great craft beer as we are, and we want to be the best company to work. Ever. We've also done some pretty insane stuff in our time, like brewing a beer at the bottom of the ocean, and driving outside the Bank of England in a tank to launch our Equity for Punks investment program. Here's what some other people have said about us in the past:


 

Equity for Punks USA

If you want to join our legion of 50,000 craft beer fans across the world, check out Equity for Punks USA, where you can invest in our US business, BrewDog USA Inc. By investing in Equity for Punks USA, you'll get access to even more extra special perks including:

  • Owning equity in our company
  • Lifetime discounts in our bars and online shop
  • Tours of both our breweries in Ohio and Scotland
  • Exclusive beers including the world's strongest beer, The End of History
  • Signed books
  • Merch
  • Small batch whiskies
  • Your name on one of our fermentation vessels!

FAQS

When will The DogHouse open?
Assuming we hit our funding goal, we are hoping to launch The DogHouse by the end of Q3 2018. The plans are already a work in progress, and design should be locked down by the end of June 2017. As and when we develop new ideas and designs, we will share them with backers!

Why Columbus?
We found a great site with amazing utilities, logistics and expansion potential in Columbus Ohio, and after spending only 24 hours in the Discovery City, knew this was where we belonged in America! There is a huge opportunity for our beers in the Mid-West, and there are no other mid-sized craft breweries in the Columbus area. Columbus is within 500 miles of over half of the US population, so we're well located for distribution as well as travel. The reception from the local community has been absolutely incredible -  we love (LOVE) the city of Columbus.

Can you send me my awesome sour beers through the mail?
Due to various laws as well as restrictions on alcohol offered through perks on Indiegogo, we're unable to send you any beer. Sad face. However, we will provide vouchers for these, and you can come and collect your beers from our brewery once they're released! We'll keep you posted on when you can expect them to be ready for collection, and you may as well book a night in the hotel while you're in town! What better excuse than to spend a night in The DogHouse than checking in on your investment? You can thank us later.

Where can I try your beer?
BrewDog beer is available to sample from our DogTap taproom at our brewery in Columbus, Ohio! You can also try our beer around the world in any one of our 60 distribution markets (served by our Ellon brewery), in any of our 49 bars globally, and you'll soon be able to get amazing BrewDog beer across America once we release our first beers out of Columbus!

Can I see your website?
Sure! Visit brewdog.com!

I have some questions - can I talk to you?
Sure thing! Email sarah@brewdog.com or if you've backed our campaign, you can head to the comments and talk to us there!

Love hops and live the dream

BrewDog x
story_txt:
**STRETCH GOAL ACHIEVED!!**
With such an overwhelming response to our campaign, we introduced a stretch goal, and successfully smashed $200,000! With these additional funds, we will be able to build a rooftop residents’ bar at The DogHouse, serving a selection of the amazing sour beers brewed right next door! The following perks are now available to redeem! Get sharing it with your buddies!

Hello, we are BrewDog.
In 2007, BrewDog  was born on the rugged coast of North East Scotland. Over the past 10 years, we have grown to become UK's best selling craft beer, we export to 60 countries and we run 49 bars across the world. We started out with a mission to make other people as passionate about great craft beer as we are, and that's still our mission today.
Our first craft brewery in the US launched this year in Columbus, Ohio. We are now offering the opportunity to get involved in the world's first crowdfunded craft beer hotel, attached to a brand new sour beer facility, all located on our site in Columbus. 

By supporting this project, you will be staking your claim on one of our most ambitious projects to date. This hotel will provide a complete experiential environment in which to truly immerse yourself in the world of craft beer. From waking up to a view of our sour beer foeders and the smell of freshly mashed malt, to hop-infused spa treatments and beer breakfasts, and even amazing craft beer on tap in your bedroom - this hotel will have it all.


Why The DogHouse?
We want to create the top craft beer destination on the planet. Our brewery in Ellon, Scotland has become a destination for craft beer fans across Europe, and we want to build an even more amazing beer destination stateside. With The DogHouse focused on amazing craft beer from BrewDog and our favourite breweries worldwide, we're creating the ideal environment in which to immerse yourself in the ultimate beery weekend.Forget Disneyland. This is the new happiest (or hoppiest) place on Earth.

Sour brewing provides the opportunity to experiment and innovate with the weirdest, most wonderful styles of beer the world has to offer. By building a dedicated sour beer facility on site at our brewery in Columbus, Ohio, we're setting ourselves up to start building some insane recipes without impacting on our day-to-day brewing.  
What We Need & What You Get
The BrewDog hotel & sour beer brewery will cost $6million to build and furnish, and the proceeds of this campaign will enable us to fast track the project through to completion. As you can see, the designs are well underway and we should have these finalized by June 2017. The build will then be accelerated in order for the hotel to be operational by Q3 2018. 

DogHouse will have craft beer at its core. We have already started work developing some craft beer spa treatments, with bespoke hop oils (to emulate your favorite beers) and malted barley massages, as well as a 'hoppy feet' pedicure to put a spring in your step before a brewery tour! Fully immerse yourself in the world of craft beer during your stay, enjoy craft beer infused breakfasts, lunches and dinners, with beers paired to every course. 
Our rooms will also all be themed around the world of BrewDog beer, with specialist suites that take you on a tour of our history, design, and passion that goes into every beer we make. We will also be installing shower beer fridges into our en suite rooms, so you're never more than arm's reach away from a chilled can of Punk IPA.

By backing our DogHouse and sour beer facility project, you'll unlock some amazing, money-can't buy perks and rewards that will elevate your visit to our brand new brewery and beer-themed hotel!
Read more about each perk and the items included on the pitch page. 

As well as being a part of the world's first fully-immersive craft beer hotel, you'll also be supporting the creation of 80 new jobs in the Columbus area, and further contributing to BrewDog's positive impact on the local area.  

Risks & Challenges
BrewDog owns the land on which we intend to construct The DogHouse, and we have established great connections with the City of Canal Winchester. The local authorities are fully supportive of our mission and goals in the region, and the brewery is located just 10 miles away from downtown Columbus with plenty of travel links on our doorstep. Although this will be our first hotel worldwide, we have an expert retail division with extensive experience in the hospitality and hotel industries.
Our 100,000 sq ft brewery is partially funded by 'Equity for Punks USA', via which we have raised $3.75million to date. You can join our global community of 55,000 craft beer renegade investors, and own a stake in BrewDog USA Inc. by buying shares right here.  
Provided we hit at least our minimum raise on Indiegogo, we have the balance of funds required in the profitability of the business to launch as per our timeline. All funds raised over the minimum will just allow us to move faster, and welcome you guys in before the general public!

The Team
BrewDog was launched in 2007 by James Watt and Martin Dickie. The pair set out on a mission to make other people as passionate about great craft beer as they were. Ten years later, they have together grown the business from brewing beers by hand in a garage in North East Scotland, to one of the world's most exciting craft breweries. James and Martin have recruited a crack team of ambitious, experienced individuals who make up 'Mission Control'. Here's the skinny on BrewDog's US senior team:
James Watt (Above, right)
Captain & Co-founder James Watt was a fully qualified deep sea Captain, having earlier completed an honours degree in Law & Economics. He traded in being a salty sea dog to become a BrewDog in 2007, pursuing his passion for great craft beer by setting up the company with Martin Dickie. James was awarded Great British Entrepreneur of the Year in 2014, and is one of only 13 Master Cicerones worldwide.
Martin Dickie (Above, left)
Beer Pirate & Co-founder Martin Dickie has a first class honours degree in Brewing & Distilling from Herriot Watt University. He is a renegade artist on a mission to change people’s perceptions about beer and challenge their tastebuds. Along with James, Martin hosts the hit international TV show Brew Dogs.
Allison Green (Above, top right)
People Director Ally joined BrewDog from B&M Retail (a FTSE 250 listed company) at the beginning of 2016 with the brief to make BrewDog the best employer. Ever. 
Neil Simpson (Above, bottom left)
Finance Director Neil Simpson joined BrewDog in August 2012 bringing with him over 20 years of experience, (10 of which were at partner level). Neil is a qualified chartered accountant with the Institute of Chartered Accountants in Scotland.
Tim Hawn (Above, top left)
Head of Production at BrewDog’s Columbus brewery is Tim Hawn. For the past nineteen years, Tim has brewed beers for Boston Beer Company and Pete’s Wicked Ales, as well as a large multinational brewer, and held the position of Brewmaster at Dogfish Head Craft Brewery.
David McDowall (Above, bottom right)
Retail Director David joined BrewDog PLC from G1 Group PLC, where he held the position of Group Operations Director for six years. He has experience managing over 50 sites and is responsible for overseeing the strategic growth and management of our global bar division.Richard Kilcullen (not pictured)Sour brewing expert, Richard joined the good ship BrewDog in early 2017 from Wicked Weed, where he held the position of Head of Sour Production. Richard will play an integral part in the set up of the sour beer facility in Columbus.
BrewDogFrom our Scottish Head Quarters we export our beer into 60 countries worldwide, we have 49 amazing craft beer bars in 11 different countries, and our new brewery in Columbus Ohio is now open too. We are laser focused on two things as a business; beer and people. We are on a mission to make other people as passionate about great craft beer as we are, and we want to be the best company to work. Ever. We've also done some pretty insane stuff in our time, like brewing a beer at the bottom of the ocean, and driving outside the Bank of England in a tank to launch our Equity for Punks investment program. Here's what some other people have said about us in the past: 
Equity for Punks USA
If you want to join our legion of 50,000 craft beer fans across the world, check out Equity for Punks USA, where you can invest in our US business, BrewDog USA Inc. By investing in Equity for Punks USA, you'll get access to even more extra special perks including:

Owning equity in our company
Lifetime discounts in our bars and online shop
Tours of both our breweries in Ohio and Scotland
Exclusive beers including the world's strongest beer, The End of History
Signed books
Merch
Small batch whiskies
Your name on one of our fermentation vessels!


FAQS
When will The DogHouse open?Assuming we hit our funding goal, we are hoping to launch The DogHouse by the end of Q3 2018. The plans are already a work in progress, and design should be locked down by the end of June 2017. As and when we develop new ideas and designs, we will share them with backers!
Why Columbus?We found a great site with amazing utilities, logistics and expansion potential in Columbus Ohio, and after spending only 24 hours in the Discovery City, knew this was where we belonged in America! There is a huge opportunity for our beers in the Mid-West, and there are no other mid-sized craft breweries in the Columbus area. Columbus is within 500 miles of over half of the US population, so we're well located for distribution as well as travel. The reception from the local community has been absolutely incredible -  we love (LOVE) the city of Columbus.
Can you send me my awesome sour beers through the mail?Due to various laws as well as restrictions on alcohol offered through perks on Indiegogo, we're unable to send you any beer. Sad face. However, we will provide vouchers for these, and you can come and collect your beers from our brewery once they're released! We'll keep you posted on when you can expect them to be ready for collection, and you may as well book a night in the hotel while you're in town! What better excuse than to spend a night in The DogHouse than checking in on your investment? You can thank us later.
Where can I try your beer?BrewDog beer is available to sample from our DogTap taproom at our brewery in Columbus, Ohio! You can also try our beer around the world in any one of our 60 distribution markets (served by our Ellon brewery), in any of our 49 bars globally, and you'll soon be able to get amazing BrewDog beer across America once we release our first beers out of Columbus!Can I see your website?Sure! Visit brewdog.com!
I have some questions - can I talk to you?Sure thing! Email sarah@brewdog.com or if you've backed our campaign, you can head to the comments and talk to us there!

story:
Hi! I’m Chef Shel Leigh or Michelle, whichever you prefer to call me. I have a Master’s degree in Education, am a certified plant-based chef, and a woman with a vision. I want to make it easier to be healthy by bringing my line of plant-based gluten-free products to a store near you. 

 Kula is a sanskrit word which means community of choice or heart. I started making vegan cheese in my kid’s closet a year ago. Since then, through the will of the community, we have grown into a full-fledged rapidly expanding business. In order to get our products to more locations, near you, we need help. 

We re-invest every cent in the company and have been going without heat just to keep going. When you help us today you will be helping us pay to get the additional product testing done so we can launch more of our products, source sustainable packaging and hire some help in the kitchen. 

We are trying to raise $55,000 

This amount will solve all of our immediate growth needs and set us up to keep growing. The money for a good quality heating/air system will allow us to work in greater comfort and better regulate temperatures for fermentation.

The money for two part-time salaries will allow us to expand exponentially. With more help we will be able to create more products, sell more products and grow. 

The money “earmarked” for testing will allow us to create HACCP plans and test our mushroom jerky and mushroom meat products. 

New market gear is needed before the next farmer’s market season which starts in late March. We want to purchase sustainable electric coolers, signage, and displays. 

 

If we don’t reach our funding goals any monies earned will be spent in the order listed: heat, salaries, testing, market gear.

 

$8000 will go for heat/air system for the Kula Kitchen

20,000 part-time salary 

20,000 part-time salary

$2,000 New Market Gear 

$5,000 Product Testing and Packaging

 

For helping with our campaign you’ll be the first to receive our exclusive products. 

$50 contribution = powder pack (includes our powdered cheese, coco mix, and brownie mix)

$100 contribution = Lg. Powder pack (includes our powdered cheese, coco mix, brownie mix, pancake mix and waffle mix)

$500 contribution = Refrigeration pack (5 powders + refrigerated cashew cheese sampler pack)

$1000 contribution = Lg Powder pack & Refrigeration pack PLUS all new Kula products for life! Anytime Chef Shel Leigh creates a new product (which is several times a year)...you will be the first to receive it and invited to provide feedback, help name and market the product. 

$5000 contribution = Chef Shel will travel to you to cook a private dinner for up to 10 people

 

Helping Kula Foods grow will pave the way for a new generation of products to take hold in the marketplace. Products that are sustainable, honest and designed for health. 

We’ve taken this company from a concept to a product. In our first year we generated 100K in revenue just from sales at one farmer’s market and proven there is a demand for our products. We need help taking the next steps to get these products to a wider audience. 

Kula Foods is a chef driven, woman led company which creates superior products designed for maximum health. It was born out of Michelle’s own experience, illness and her passion to make healthy food accessible while providing knowledge and information to help educate the consumer. Our cashew cheeses are fermented and offer all the benefits of cashews and probiotics. All our products are engineered for optimal health benefits. Our mushroom jerky is 30% protein and rich in vitamins and nutrients. Many of our products affect your serotonin levels and will help improve your mood. Hence our tagline, Good Mood Food. 

 

We’re asking for help today so we can continue to grow our product offerings while maintaining control for the line. This will not be easy and almost as soon as we grow we’ll need to grow again, but these next steps, the ones your contribution will be helping us take, are among the most important. We will expand to more markets, have more product testing done and hire some help. This will, in turn, allow us to generate enough income to take future growth steps on our own. 

These next steps are critical to our success and longevity as a company. We have shown ourselves to have the grit, determination, and the bootstrap mentality necessary to succeed. We so appreciate your help today whether you are able to contribute monetarily or by sharing the campaign with your friend group we are grateful to you.

story:
With lessons learned, Pruno & Hooch has partnered with Homeboy Industries to provide high-risk, formerly gang-involved inmates, counseling and support to enter back into society as contributing members of our communities.

A portion of pledged funds will go directly to Homeboy Industries.

Joe Davis, the Co-founder of Pruno & Hooch had the unfortunate and fortunate experience of spending time in jail. Prior to prison, Joe was the executive producer for the movie BOTTLE SHOCK; an award winning film that tells the true story of Chateau Montelena, and how it launched Napa Valley as a wine community. 

So what does Joe do after serving his time of 5 1/2 months? He brings home and creates an American heritage brand; capitalizing on 100 year old iconic brands, pruno & hooch, that have been inside the prison systems. 

Pruno has been around for over a century, and is known west of the Mississippi. This prison made alcohol east of the Mississippi is known as hooch. 

It has been an inmate staple for inside prison walls for centuries. Both are alcoholic beverages made by prisoners for prisoners. 

Hidden from the guards and prison wardens, pruno and hooch is stashed under the inmates’ bunks, inside walls and toilets, or in the shower area. 

VOTE! The coast with the most funds raised will be host to the Exclusive Pruno & Hooch After Party. By making a $2 pledge or "vote", your $2 pledge will be your ticket in, should your coast come on top. NY represents ALL of the east coast, and LA represents ALL of the west coast.

The "after party" will be a FREE concert by a multi-platinum hip hop recording artist. 

Trust us...you will NOT want to miss this!



Inmates make their “wines” with scraps of apples, oranges, fruit cocktail, ketchup, sugar, milk, and other ingredients, they can smuggle into their cells. Bread provides the yeast for the Pruno or Hooch to ferment, then turning it into alcohol. 

The concoction can be made using only a plastic bag, hot running water, and a towel or sock to conceal the pulp during fermentation. 

A dangerous undertaking for a prisoner... but in the end, much worth the risk for a coveted glass of Pruno or Hooch! 

This historical, classic beverage, originating from prisoners, is now a concept bottled with delicious California juice. It can be purchased at your local Mom & Pop shops. 

Pruno & Hooch Moscato will be a third wine product. Moscato is by far, the fastest-growing wine varietal in the United States marketplace today, and especially among the millennial generation and urban demo-graphic.

Anything but homemade.

To the contrary, while the brand harkens back to a dark memory, the present-day Pruno & Hooch wines will be professionally bottled, attractively bottled, well-priced and wonderful wines. 

All of the juice will come from California, from delicious grapes. With an unbeatable price tag, equaling the same price as a 20 oz. Red Bull. 

Support Pruno & Hooch by pledging for some of the rewards below. 

Pruno & Hooch Money Roll - 2 for $5

DESCRIPTION: The Pruno & Hooch money roll band. Hold your money together with this authentic P&H band.

Pruno & Hooch License Plate Frame - $10

DESCRIPTION: Rep your coast with either the West Coast Pruno or East Coast Hooch Licence Plate Frame. 

Pruno & Hooch T-Shirt or Tank Top - $20

DESCRIPTION: Rep your coast with either the West Coast Pruno or East Coast Hooch T-Shirt or Tank Top. Available in either Black or White, East Coast or West Coast.

Pruno & Hooch Women's Top - $20

DESCRIPTION: Rep your coast with either the West Coast Pruno or East Coast Hooch Women's Top. Available in either Black or White, East Coast or West Coast.

Pruno & Hooch Premium Hat - $25

DESCRIPTION: Rep your coast with either the West Coast Pruno or East Coast Hooch Premium Hat. Available in many styles, East Coast or West Coast.

Pruno & Hooch Lighter & Flask Set - $25

DESCRIPTION: Rep your coast with either the West Coast Pruno or East Coast Hooch Lighter and Flask Set. Available in either Black or White, East Coast or West Coast.

Pruno & Hooch Hoodie - $35

DESCRIPTION: Rep your coast with either the West Coast Pruno or East Coast Hooch Hoodie. Available in either Black or Grey, East Coast or West Coast.

Pruno & Hooch Case of 12 Bottles - $50

DESCRIPTION: Get your drink on with a case of Pruno & Hooch. Choose between either the West Coast Pruno (Red), The East Coast Hooch (White) or the Bi-Coastal Moscato.

Pruno & Hooch Swag Bag - $60

DESCRIPTION: Rep your coast with either the West Coast Pruno or East Coast Hooch Swag Bag. Your choice of any 3 items: License Plate, Flask/ Lighter Set, T-shirt/ Tank Top, Women's Top, P&H Hat. Heck, we will even throw in the money roll too!

Pruno & Hooch Case of 24 Bottles - $100

DESCRIPTION: Get your drink on with 2 cases of Pruno & Hooch. Make your own case by picking between either the West Coast Pruno (Red), The East Coast Hooch (White) or the Bi-Coastal Moscato.

Los Angeles  Party With Jay-Z & Beyonce (Aug. 3rd) - $1,000

DESCRIPTION: All Pruno & Hooch swag + One night stay at the Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel + 2 tickets to Jay-Z & Beyonce at the Staples Center + Visit the Pruno & Hooch offices and party with Joe Davis + surprise gift in your hotel room.

Melbourne Party With Kanye West 

(Sept. 9th) - $1,000

DESCRIPTION: All Pruno & Hooch swag + One night stay at the Langham Melbourne Hotel + 2 tickets to Kanye West at the Rod Laver Arena + A guided tour of the historical jail, The Old Melbourne Gaol + surprise gift in your hotel room. 

San Francisco Party With Wiz Khalifa & Young Jeezy (Aug 22nd) - $1,000

DESCRIPTION: All Pruno & Hooch swag + One night stay at the Intercontinental San Francisco + 2 tickets to Wiz Khalifa and Young Jeezy at The Shoreline Amphitheater + A two hour guided tour for two of the historical island of Alcatraz + surprise gift in your hotel room.

London Party With Pharrell (Oct. 9th) - $1,000

DESCRIPTION: All Pruno & Hooch swag + One night stay at the Montcalm Hotel + 2 tickets to Pharrell at the O2 Arena + A two hour guided tour of historical Clink Prison + surprise gift in your hotel room.

NYC Party With Rhianna & Eminem + Celebrity HipHop Tour (Aug. 17th) - $1,500

DESCRIPTION: All Pruno & Hooch swag + Two night stay at the Viceroy + 2 tickets to Rhianna & Eminem at the MetLife Arena + A four hour, celebrity guided hip-hop tour of the birthplace of hip hop, in the Bronx & Harlem. Aug. 16 (Kurtis Blow, Grand Master CAZ, or Raheim) + surprise gift in your hotel room.

Extra In Pruno & Hooch Commercial - $3,000

DESCRIPTION: Be an extra in the Pruno & Hooch commercial with our brand ambassador and multi-platinum recording artist, to be announced after crowd funding campaign + One night stay at the famous Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel + Visit to the Pruno & Hooch office on the walk of fame & lunch with the Co-Founders.

Feature In Pruno & Hooch Commercial - $5,000

DESCRIPTION: Be a featured role in the Pruno & Hooch commercial with our brand ambassador and multi-platinum recording artist, to be announced after crowd funding campaign + One night stay at the famous Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel + Visit to the Pruno & Hooch office on the walk of fame & lunch with the Co-Founders

As well as being a successful movie producer in Hollywood, and a wine connoisseur, Davis has had much success with his entrepreneurial endeavors with companies such as Aamco, Chevrolet, and Trauma Records.

In 2012 while Joe was in production on various celebrity commercial projects, a surprise that he believes was a part of his destiny, came knocking at his door…. 

The FBI indicted Joe for taxes, and he was immediately taken to a down town Los Angeles mens federal holding facility.

Prison is no joke. The underground world is full of dangerous bureaucracy, drugs, assault and things you can not even imagine; and of course… make shift wineries. 

No one imagines that one day they will be in prison, locked up from everything familiar... but it was there that I realized what is important in life.

"I had lived an incredible life up until this point, being in the music business and entertainment business had allowed me the ultimate in luxuries. I had had it all.

From homes on the beach, to Rolls Royce's, to private jets with celebrities.

...and now I had found myself in prison, penniless, and abandoned by all. I realized then and there, that this was my journey, that the reason I ended up in this situation was to discover Pruno & Hooch."

Joe Davis 

Life is precious, we do make mistakes, but it's who we become from them that matters…

This new born idea gave Joe hope, and helped him deal with the heartache that he faced in prison, of losing everything he had once built. 

"I plan to give 5% to a charity which helps the recidivism rate of inmates." 

"I am very passionate about second chances in life, and know that giving back to inmates who truly want to make a better life for themselves, is now my calling and my vehicle is Pruno & Hooch."

Or, do... Just be sure to mail Joe a souvenir...

Joe Davis | 7080 Hollywood Blvd. #1100 | Los Angeles, CA 90028

The concoction can be made using only a plastic bag, hot running water, and a towel or sock to conceal the pulp during fermentation.
